item.title: Gamification in online gambling
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
Gamification in online gambling

What is gamification in online gambling? Gamification in online gaming is an interesting concept that has been gaining popularity in the online gaming and sports betting industry. It involves adding game-like elements to a task or activity to make it more enjoyable, engaging, and rewarding for players. This could include leaderboards, rewards for completing tasks, […]

What is gamification in online gambling?

Gamification in online gaming is an interesting concept that has been gaining popularity in the online gaming and sports betting industry. It involves adding game-like elements to a task or activity to make it more enjoyable, engaging, and rewarding for players. This could include leaderboards, rewards for completing tasks, badges, achievements for hitting certain milestones, or even virtual currency or points for playing. 

In the case of online sports betting, gamification can introduce a competitive element that encourages players to return again and again to achieve their goals. Players can compete with each other on leaderboards or try to beat certain challenges that are set out by the gamification system. Bonus points and rewards can be used as incentives for reaching new levels or achieving milestones. In some cases, gamification has also been used to introduce challenges like predicting the outcomes of games to give gamblers another way of engaging with the site beyond just placing bets. 

Gamification also adds additional layers of customization options within the gaming environment. Players can customize their avatars and profiles to stand out from other competitors. At the same time, they play an element of gamification that appeals strongly to many gamers who enjoy personalizing their experience within a game world. Additionally, gamification often incorporates social media components such as chat boxes and forums, which allows players to engage with one another. At the same time, they play games together – creating a sense of camaraderie as they play against each other or join forces toward a common goal. 

In conclusion, a gamification is an effective tool for increasing engagement levels among players and encouraging loyalty within sports betting communities – making it an important part of modern-day gambling platforms.

item.title: Multi-tenant gaming platform
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
Multi-tenant gaming platform

Multi-tenant gaming platform for operating multiple markets concurrently changes the paradigm of operating online gaming business.

Multi-tenant approach.

The development of multi-tenant gaming platform technology is closely related to the unprecedented growth of online gaming. During the last 10-15 years the changes are particularly noticeable. A lot low regulated markets adopted regulation. But still, international markets with little or no regulation vacuum in international dot com operators.

DotCom operators.

It’s common that a company operating a dot com gaming platform in a low regulated environment has a licensed business in one of the European or Eastern European states. And it is done for a good purpose. Such setup allows a company to use the local license in order to establish stable relations with banks and payment solutions. Those financial institutions often require one of the well-recognized and reputable licenses to successfully take the company through the KYC and on-boarding procedures. 

Once all those things are in place and relations established, a company can start multitasking. Usually, it will juggle between highly regulated established markets and low-regulated maturing ones.

Paradigm change.

While legal setup can be done by the legal team, most companies’ biggest operational challenge is a platform technology. After a while, it becomes impossible for an operator to successfully use the same online gaming platform in different and rapidly changing environments.

Multi-tenant gaming technology in this case is a paradigm change.  A multi-tenant approach to solving operational issues of operators serving multiple markets allows much greater flexibility and scalability.  It ensures that all tenants/brands act as independent business units. It is important that a multi-tenant solution provides a single point of managing all of the tenants with ease and convenience.

Tenants and technology provider – 101

There are several terms used for platform operators that rent or buy the platform from a technology company. The most universally used term is “Tenant”.

A technology company that develops and provides an online platform mostly employs 3 distinct models of conducting business with the operators.

White Lable is probably the most common one. When a technology company provides a gaming platform under the White Lable model, an operator rents the platform and receives all technical and legal support he requires. Usually, it’s done for a fee. Legal support means using the Technology company license to operate the platform in various markets this license allows to cover.

The second popular model is called Turn Key. This is very similar to the White Label model but does not include Legal Support. Any operator who is using this model is required to use his own licenses to operate the markets. Under the Turn Key model, an operator is still renting the platform.

The third model is called the Complete package. It is not as common as the previous two. Usually, this model is popular among large operators. They are capable of acquiring the whole technology (know-how and source code). Large operators usually do not want to operate under the Tenant Agreement. Anyone who chooses this route must be capable to support and service technology in the long run.

The same three models are also applicable to the multi-tenant gaming platform.

B2C as a starting point.

The vast majority of online betting companies providing gaming platforms started their business as a B2C business. The architecture of their gaming platforms was initially designed to service one operator. The multi-tenant gaming platform approach was developed just recently.

As time passed such Business to Customer (or rather Business to Player in our case) companies grew and obtained experience. Those of them with more technical knowledge started testing their strength in the B2B vertical. But only very few succeeded. And there is a reason.

Multi-tenant gaming platform – the right fit for low-regulated markets.

Those who started operations in multiple markets simultaneously, quickly realized the need for something very different from the modified and repackaged version of the B2C platform. Most of the gaming platforms are offered by the technology providers deeply rooted in the “one operator-one platform paradigm”.

The very essence of the foreign markets that are still establishing a regulatory framework is their unpredictability and uncertainty. Being fast is more important than being first or even being best. To succeed, an operator must learn to benefit from the environment.

A permanent, intolerable uncertainty has to become a new normal, and an operator must surf on its waves and flourish in order to make online operations possible and, what’s more critical – profitable.

Operating an online gaming business in maturing dot com markets on a standard gaming platform that does not offer multi-tenant functionality is like trying to juggle with one hand and one ball. You will certainly lose to someone who has either two hands or more balls.

Balancing risks and the law of averages.

To succeed in foreign low regulated markets, operators try to use the law of averages. Operators hedge their market-bets by placing eggs in more than one basket. They are filling in individual baskets for every market. Or is it just what they think they do?

Essentially, when an operator acquires a traditional gaming platform it asks a technical company – platform provider to launch different localized instances of the platform for each of the markets. But even when the platform provider fulfills the request – the eggs still remain in the same basket. They just become different colors. What’s even more tragic, most of those eggs will never hatch. 

There are many reasons as to why it happens. Local governments decide to take their share of taxes, they often bind to pressure to legislate the industry, block specific payment getaways, impose gamble-aware procedures, etc.

Local players require distinct localizations, risk management, and personalization. And we are just scratching the surface. A multi-tenant gaming platform solves most if not all of those problems.

Multi-tenant architecture – Go Global Stay Local approach.

A multi-tenant gaming platform that employs multi-tenant architecture is the technology built from the ground up. A multi-tenant gaming platform is free from all the diseases of the standard modified platform.

It offers unseen before flexibility and provides infinite opportunities for customization of each of the tenants and brands. All tenants stay completely independent from each other. And what is a very important thing to keep in mind, all tenants not only look different, but their behavior is different also.

Go Global by Staying Local strategy of the multi-tenant gaming platform pays off big dividends. 

Independent management of the tenants and brands as a new industry standard.

Every tenant/brand can have its individual settings that do not affect other tenants/brands. Some of them are risk and limit settings, taxation rules, sportsbook margins and pricing, bet delays, invoicing, enhanced marketing offers.

The personalization engine is responsible for delivering a unique experience to payers based upon individual tenant settings. Tenants and brands are completely independent of one another.

Easy-to-use CMS makes it convenient to apply not only cosmetic and structural changes to the front end but sets individual back end changes to the processing logic for each tenant and brand. Especially multi-tenant setup is important for the companies providing sportsbook solutions.

Multi-tenant gaming platform combined with an omnichannel delivery infrastructure.

Multi-tenant technology becomes especially powerful when it is combined with an omnichannel delivery infrastructure. Whilst multi-tenancy allows operators to manage tenants independently, the omnichannel infrastructure delivers the same personalized experience across various channels.

The players can use their unique personalized offers and keep their personal settings unchanged across all available points of access such as website, native apps, stand-alone kiosks, and land-based solutions.

Pioneers in the multi-tenant platform technology.

To become really successful in creating multi-tenant software solutions a company must not only use the latest technology but also be able to employ a different methodology and philosophy when it comes to platform management and distributed functionality.  The context of the concept of parts in their relation to the whole must be reevaluated and clearly understood by engineers and businesses.

INPLAYSOFT

INPLAYSOFT has pioneered the field of multi-tenant solutions for the sports betting industry. It became the first company in sports betting that developed a completely functional multi-tenant and multi-brand sports betting system from the ground up.

The system is very much unique and has no analogs. It is absolutely free from the common limitations attributed to the standard gaming and sports betting platforms. The multi-tenant platform offers unique customization and personalization freedom of managing tenants independently. 

Aristotle said that “The whole is more than the sum of its parts”. INPLAYSOFT multi-tenant gaming platform developers have re-evaluated this statement and took it one step further: “The part stays equal to the whole ”.

Go Global, Stay Local!

item.title: Metaverse Gambling
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
Metaverse Gambling

What is the metaverse Gambling? Metaverse gambling is becoming a significant opportunity for future growth of all I-Gaming sectors. Some I-Gaming experts say there is more hype around metaverse gambling, but others see it as the future and the only way I-Gaming can catch up with the latest technologies and user expectations. Let’s try to […]

What is the metaverse Gambling?

Metaverse gambling is becoming a significant opportunity for future growth of all I-Gaming sectors. Some I-Gaming experts say there is more hype around metaverse gambling, but others see it as the future and the only way I-Gaming can catch up with the latest technologies and user expectations. Let’s try to understand which is a more likely use of Metaverse for Gambling.

Beginning of Metaverse.

Not long ago, Facebook announced that it had changed its name to Meta. In one day, Meta shares increased their value by 2%. But what sent the ripples across all I-Gaming sectors was the Meta announcement of building the project in a virtual reality called Horizon Worlds. 

Loots of software companies providing I-Gaming, Casino, and Sportsbetting solutions jumped in on the idea to participate and started planning of building their Metaverses. Even a technology giant Baidu joined the metaverse bandwagon by running a “Land of Hope” conference. A search began for the companies with enough expertise to take upon Virtual Reality related projects. Developers, even with little knowledge about VR, became hard to find. Many investors started to think Metaverses offered a gold mine opportunity.

Marketing divisions of online Sportsbetting and Casino companies began capitalizing on the hype almost instantly. Metaverse gambling-related content started selling like hot pies. Metaverse software development projects began to grow.

To understand how Technology Companies involved in the Gambling Industry can benefit from being involved in Metaverse Gambling, one needs to study the roots of Metaverse.

Metaverse idea started from private networks.

In reality, some of the older and more experienced developers I spoke to regarding Metaverses point out that creating a computer network closed world type of games is not a new idea. The idea of closed spaces was popular a long time ago. Some examples are America Online, Prodigy, or Compuserve commercial networks which tried to compete with global internet networks back in the 1980s. Those closed corporate or private networks were full of exciting content. People could read the news, listen to music, and even watch shows.

The primary purpose of creating private networks was to get more user attention and lure the User away from the internet. So how did it go? Did corporations manage to make their loyal fans and keep them in? As we know, they lost the war of building fences. Eventually, even America Online became one of the biggest internet service providers.

From networks to portals.

Private and corporate Networks morphed into Portals. Gambling projects tried to integrate their services and provide them as Portal widgets via API integration. We all know such portals as AOL, Yandex, Mail.ru, and many others. The idea of creating user ecosystems that may be used to exploit the User’s time and attention via monetization through bringing Users to the Portal marketplaces is still alive. But while the companies focused exclusively on portal-creation tasks, they forgot about the User’s needs. Most of the available Portal links led to internal marketplaces, internal chats, or internal content. With the growing number of portals, the User did not want to stay tied up to any particular one but rather enjoy the best and most exciting options across all Portals. Each portal started to look like a very small Metaverse, but none of the companies seemed to provide everything under one hood. And that’s when Google came into play.

Google – to rule them all.

Corporations learned the lessons and stopped putting the boundaries for the users. The users desperately wanted something which could deliver honest search results and find the information they needed. Google came at the right time. Besides becoming hugely popular as a Search Engine, Google became a focal point for every gambling company. Technology Companies and operators started using clever tricks to optimize their content for specific Google keywords. They also desperately tried to improve their organic search results. But Google does not treat Gambling well. With the Google restrictions that are hard to fight, Gambling operators and Gambling software providers turned their attention to the social networks, video platforms, and messengers.

Social Platforms as a congregation point.

Facebook’s rapid growth was not accidental. Users grew tired of portals. With more and more people joining the internet and sharing content, portals could not keep up with users’ expectations for diversity, novelty, and relevance. On the other hand, Facebook found a way to assign a content creation task to users, making himself the most significant Player. Facebook became a universal platform for hosting all users’ metaverses. B2B gambling providers utilized Facebook’s tools for getting the message across to operators, while Instagram became one of the most used alternatives for B2C Gambling operators.

Technology brings not only new projects but builds more delivery channels. Users’ attention is getting limited. To keep up with all exciting projects, users spend less time on each of them. Even though Gambling and especially Gambling in Metaverse can be pretty addictive, the younger generation’s attention span is getting shorter and shorter. TikTok, Roblox, and other newcomers to the market realized that the game now is not about perfection. It’s about frequency and relevance.

No Perfection required – TikTok.

A new era began with the Platforms that realized it and implemented it into their flow. TikTok, Like, Roblox are much more addictive than Facebook or Instagram could ever hope to become. The scariest thing about these new attention-grabbing platforms is that their users do not have any pressing need to exit them. The younger generation does not go to Facebook to like their parents’ posts or Instagram to appreciate other people’s photos. They go to Roblox or TikTok to upgrade their pets, trade their stuff, and sign up to new accounts. Now it is about “them” and not “others.” Perfection is not a required attribute here. Simple design and frequently updated content that does not take a long time to watch are more critical.

2021 – Metaverse reserection.

So can Mark Zuckerberg and Satya Nadella sit and wait as they are losing customers? What would be a solution to hold the customers while engaging them in content creation?

The answer was simple: Let’s do what we have done, but we will do it better this time!

Can Gaming and especially Gambling transform its Marketing Approach as fast as technologies change? Can Metaverse gambling become real? Certainly.

The answer we hear from most big corporations is quite simple: let’s improve the graphic, add more features, add more products and empower the sales team. That’s one of the reasons the resurrection of the Metaverse and using Metaverse for Gambling became so popular. But it’s an old-new idea – bring the users in and put a lock on the doors.

Metaverse for Gambling.

In reality, the term Metaverse for Gambling is extensive. It encompasses loads of different ideas. But the main idea is that Metaverse is a space populated by users who can participate in various activities and competitions. 

A lot of effort is spent making hardware that Metaverse users can use. The main goal of the Metaverse hardware and software is to make the Metaverse world feel as accurate as possible. Metaverse gambling should substitute real-world brick and mortar casinos, horse racing courses, and stadiums. Just imagine that all the Player needs to do to go from Las Vegas Casino to Macau Casino is press the button on their Oculus Device. There is no limit to how many times the Player can switch casinos, go from Casino to Football Stadium or other places. 

Concept of Ownership.

What if we think of one fundamental idea of Metaverse Gambling? A basic concept of Metaverse gambling is not gaming or even Gambling. The fundamental concept of Metaverse is a concept of Ownership. 

What if someone doesn’t want to be just a player but become a casino owner, run a racecourse, or establish its football league? If one looks at Metaverse gambling from the perspective of Ownership, the Metaverse idea becomes a lot more interesting. 

The problem with Gaming and Gambling Metaverse is that still, most operators think of it as something they can use to attract Players. The idea of providing ownership rights does not cross their minds. Funnily it’s a concept of Ownership and not gaming or Gambling, which can bring most revenues to the I-Gaming software providers engaged in Metaverse projects. 

Just think of how many more revenue growth opportunities are available to the B2B Company selling Metaverse casinos versus White Lable Betting Platform providers. Those Ownership related opportunities are virtually endless. They range from Virtual Real Estate Management to Development, Architecture, and Design. 

Let’s take just one example of Casino hardware manufacturers. Casino hardware manufacturers need to spend thousands of Euros to produce casino tables, Roulettes, Slot Machines, and lots of other equipment. In Gambling Metaverse, their possibilities become virtually endless. The craziest and boldest ideas can be implemented, tested, and sold within days rather than months. Suddenly, a Metaverse Casino provider becomes a Virtuals Casino Machines designer client. Companies like Microgaming and EGT can sell their Metaverse software to the Metaverse Casino provider. And the products they are going to sell will be much more exciting and engaging than the ones used on online gambling platforms. Is there a software development company that can take upon those projects? 

Metaverse – Congregation place.

There is another important concept of Metaverse Gambling. It’s called Congregation. Metaverse Universe can quickly bring people together in the virtual space. Watching sporting events or taking part in the group sporting activities in the Virtual Space is just another way to share emotions and become closer to your sporting heroes. Just think of the Software company which offers Metaverse Virtual Team creation to major football clubs! How much Chelsea or Barcelona would pay a Technology Company for that? Can there be a limit to their success if they do the job right? 

What about if instead of playing SportRadar virtual sports on one of the gaming platforms, a Player could immerse himself in the virtual environment and watch the game with other fans on the Webley Stadium? Wouldnt SportRadar jump on that idea if they had a team capable of building that software for them?

What if you could join a real football game in the virtual stadium? UEFA would undoubtedly love this idea. But who can do it for them?

Landbased Betting.

Landbased Sportsbetting is very popular. We are not a long time away before Metaverse Gambling technology can produce a digital version of the person, verify its identity, and offer betting services currently available in land-based brick and mortar points of sale. Such an option will provide unlimited customer personalization and customization opportunities. The main difference between land-based and Meta-verse betting is that Metaverse offers 24/7 access to the Player. Any marketing activities and special offers are not limited by time.

Metaverse gambling – entry threshold.

It is still the early days of Metaverse Gambling technology. But even now, Baidu claims that their “Land of Hope” Metaverse will be capable of managing more than 100 000 concurrent users even though it may take more than six years to complete the project.

Hardware and software are catching up with our imagination. Facebook’s Oculus 2 device is a fantastic piece of Technology. The entry threshold for gaming and gambling software providers to the Oculus platform is very low. Facebook and other Metaverse creators realize that the more apps they can host on their platform, more chances they have to succeed. On the other hand, the pricing model for Oculus players is probably the most attractive one amongst any gaming platform. To give an example – an average game in the Oculus store costs only 10 USD compared to the 50 USD for the new PS5 game. But the developers who can develop the VR Oculus apps and games are in short supply. Anyone who enters this market now will succeed.

BigTech and Metaverse gambling.

Big tech companies will benefit most. The truth is that even the largest Betting and Gambling companies have enough resources to create their Metaverse Gambling universes. There will probably be 3-4 large Metaverses, and the Big Tech will run them all. Some of them, if not all, will be open to Gambling. Initially, the cost of entering any of them will stay low, but as they develop and grow in size, BigTech will find ways to monetize it. There is a high chance that the winners of this Metaverse race will not be the companies that started the race. There is no doubt that the Metaverse growth will change I-Gaming and Gambling industries beyond their current state. It will set new standards for innovation, and the Player will benefit from it.

item.title: InplaySoft at SBC Summit Lisbon 2024
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to the home of the igaming community

16-19 JULY 2024 (expo days 17-18 July)

iGB L!VE connects igaming operators, affiliates, tech vendors and game providers in a live environment in order to create strong, trust-based partnerships that will drive business growth and secure competitive advantage.

The event welcomes 10,000 igaming and affiliate pioneers and supports the entire igaming ecosystem by helping businesses to navigate the ever-changing igaming landscape, providing networking opportunities, showcasing cutting-edge innovations and sharing crucial market knowledge that will empower igaming businesses to thrive in a dynamic and competitive industry.

Opening Times

Pre-registration badge collection

16 July 13:00-19:00

RAI AMSTERDAM

Exhibition Day 1

17 July 09:30 - 18:00

RAI AMSTERDAM

Exhibition Day 2

18 July 10:00 - 18:00

RAI AMSTERDAM

item.title: SBC Summit Rio
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
SBC Summit Rio

Brazil’s Senior Executive Betting & Gaming

25-27 FEBRUARY 2025RIOCENTRO, RIO DE JANEIRO

WHO ATTENDS

Delegates 0 + Operators 0 Affiliates 0 Speakers 0 Exhibitors & Sponsors 0 + SBC Summit Rio is Brazil’s Premier Sports Betting and iGaming event, slated to unfold from February 25-27, 2025, at the magnificent Riocenter in Rio de Janeiro. The venue, located in Barra da Tijuca, Rio de Janeiro, is the largest convention center in Latin America. Inaugurated in 1977, it offers a modern and versatile infrastructure, ideal for hosting events. In 2025, the SBC Summit Rio is expanding to over 50,000 square meters, making it by far the largest iGaming conference in the region.As the focal point for the flourishing gambling industry in Brazil, this summit presents an unparalleled opportunity for industry leaders, regional experts, and decision-makers to delve into the dynamic market landscape.Going beyond a conventional gathering, SBC Summit Rio stands out as a strategic platform shedding light on critical industry aspects such as regulatory frameworks, localized product offerings, operator-media relationships, sports integrity, data rights, and sponsorship opportunities. Distinguished by its ability to bring together senior executives from Brazil and across the globe, the summit offers unique insights and facilitates meaningful connections.Attending SBC Summit Rio is not just about staying informed – it’s a proactive engagement in shaping the trajectory of Brazil’s gambling landscape, making it an indispensable opportunity for those aiming to have a significant impact in this vibrant industry.

SBC Summit Rio is Brazil\u2019s Premier Sports Betting and iGaming event, slated to unfold from February 25-27, 2025, at the magnificent Riocenter in Rio de Janeiro. The venue, located in Barra da Tijuca, Rio de Janeiro, is the largest convention center in Latin America. Inaugurated in 1977, it offers a modern and versatile infrastructure, ideal for hosting events. In 2025, the SBC Summit Rio is expanding to over 50,000 square meters, making it by far the largest iGaming conference in the region.<\/span><\/div>
As the focal point for the flourishing gambling industry in Brazil, this summit presents an unparalleled opportunity for industry leaders, regional experts, and decision-makers to delve into the dynamic market landscape.<\/span><\/div>
Going beyond a conventional gathering, SBC Summit Rio stands out as a strategic platform shedding light on critical industry aspects such as regulatory frameworks, localized product offerings, operator-media relationships, sports integrity, data rights, and sponsorship opportunities. Distinguished by its ability to bring together senior executives from Brazil and across the globe, the summit offers unique insights and facilitates meaningful connections.<\/span><\/div>
Attending SBC Summit Rio is not just about staying informed \u2013 it\u2019s a proactive engagement in shaping the trajectory of Brazil\u2019s gambling landscape, making it an indispensable opportunity for those aiming to have a significant impact in this vibrant industry.<\/span><\/div>","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Arial","typography_font_size":{"unit":"px","size":16,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_mobile":{"unit":"px","size":14,"sizes":[]},"typography_line_height":{"unit":"em","size":1.600000000000000088817841970012523233890533447265625,"sizes":[]},"typography_line_height_mobile":{"unit":"em","size":1.5,"sizes":[]}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"}],"isInner":false},{"id":"d58eba9","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":null,"padding_mobile":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":true}},"elements":[{"id":"b90a189","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"https:\/\/f7v.8d6.myftpupload.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2024\/07\/sbc-summit-rio-map.webp","id":1563,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"image"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false},{"id":"29f638d","elType":"section","settings":[],"elements":[{"id":"2cce2ff","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":100,"_inline_size":null},"elements":[{"id":"20dd6fc","elType":"widget","settings":{"space":{"unit":"px","size":100,"sizes":[]}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"spacer"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

item.title: Latin America’s Premier Igaming and Sports Betting Event
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
OCTOBER 29-31 2024 SEMINOLE HARD ROCK HOTEL & CASINO, MIAMI

LATIN AMERICA’S PREMIER iGAMING AND SPORTS BETTING EVENT

WHO ATTENDS?

Delegates 0 Operators 0 Affiliates 0 Speakers 0 Exhibitors 0

Your go-to event for all things Latin America

Position yourself as a leader in Latin America’s thriving markets with SBC Summit Latinoamérica, the ultimate event for individuals and businesses seeking to expand their reach in the region.Welcoming 4,000 top-tier executives, with a notable 43% representing key decision-makers, our event promises networking opportunities tailored to drive tangible business outcomes. Leveraging the insights of 200 experts, our conference agenda dissects critical topics spanning regulation, sports betting, casinos (both land-based and online), lotteries, marketing, and compliance, while the vibrant exhibition floor showcases 70+ leading brands, offering a firsthand look at the latest innovations and solutions.Markets Covered: Brazil, Mexico, Colombia, Argentina, Perú, Venezuela, Chile, Ecuador, Bolivia, Dominican Republic, Honduras, Paraguay, El Salvador, Guatemala, Nicaragua, Costa Rica, Panamá, Uruguay, Puerto Rico and more.

item.title: The Greatest Show in Gaming
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
THE GREATEST SHOW IN GAMING

FEIRA INTERNACIONAL DE LISBOA & MEO ARENA 24 - 26 SEPTEMBER 2024

WHO ATTENDS?

Delegates 0 Operators 0 Affiliates 0 Speakers 0 Exhibitors 0

About

Gear up for an extraordinary journey with SBC Summit – the supercharged evolution of SBC Summit Barcelona, now taking place in the city of Lisbon.Imagine 450+ speakers dropping wisdom in a variety of dynamic conference formats, an electric exhibition floor spanning a whopping 100,000m2, and an opportunity to connect with 25,000 industry professionals.When you step onto the expo floor, get ready to mingle with 600 exhibitors showcasing the newest industry goodies. We’ve simplified navigation through this grand space, breaking it down into themed areas like the Casino & iGaming Zone, Sports Betting Zone, Player Protection Zone, Esports Zone and two summits: Payment Expert Summit and Affiliate Leaders Summit. Oh, and don’t overlook our Food & Hospitality and our Media Headquarters.Join us in Lisbon for an event that transcends the boundaries of mere business. SBC Summit is a plunge into a pool of innovation and collaboration. We can’t wait to see you there!

item.title: SiGMA Europe
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
SiGMA Europe

11-14 NOVEMBER 2024

Our Attendees

Delegates 0 k Speakers 0 Affiliates 0 Operators 0 Exhibitors 0 +

About SiGMA Europe

The mother of all conferences is back, breaking all records! 🇲🇹

🏠 800 sponsors and exhibitors

👫 27,000 delegates

🔈 550 speakers

🗺️5 chill out lounges

🛥️ 4 mega yachts-turned-booths

🍽️ No-expense-spared dinners

🎾 5 networking sports side-events

🎉 2 official parties

⛪️ 2 cultural activities

🏆 2 awards ceremonies

🍱 Massive food court

📣 Huge display of exhibitors outdoors

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IPjLX05g9SM

Due to our successful expansion into multiple continents, we’ve had record demand for our show in Malta. It’s truly the case that the world’s gaming community is gathering in Valletta.
 
If you’re expanding into ANY market, this show simply has to be on your diary! 📔

item.title: SiGMA Americas
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
SiGMA Americas

07-10 APRIL 2025

Our Attendees

Delegates 0 k Speakers 0 + Affiliates 0 Operators 0 Exhibitors 0 +

About SiGMA Americas

Betting on Brazil: A new era for gaming

👫 18,000 delegates

🔈 300+ speakers

🤝 Meet with industry leaders

⛰️Cultural tour

🚀 2 Startup pitches

🍽️ Exclusive networking dinners

🎉Unmissable closing party

🏆 Prestigious gala awards and auction

🤩 Big name influencers

🚦 High-value traffic

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RpSF06nYEa8

📣 The paint is barely dry on December’s milestone bill, but Brazil is booming. This attractive market promises a world of immense opportunities – and there’s everything to play for.

item.title: Usability Testing: Your Questions Answered
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded: Praesent justo nisl, auctor sed sapien ut, mattis consequat massa. Suspendisse erat lectus, pulvinar nec dapibus non, rhoncus sit amet dolor. Duis consectetur condimentum tempus. Phasellus consequat dignissim fringilla. Aenean eget enim id lectus placerat euismod. item.title: Customer Service – The Importance of Keeping Your iGaming Client Satisfied in Brazil
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
The customer is always right. Although old, this classic quote is still valid today and in the most modern businesses, such as the iGaming industry. Customer service is essential in any business and even more important in Brazil, where users can be very critical and demanding.

In Brazil, customers often decide which service they will use based on customer service evaluation metrics. The main one is the Reclame Aqui website, which offers companies with the best service, such as inplayBet, for example, the RA1000 certificate.

In this article we will explore how your business can offer the best possible communication service to its users. In this way, you will get high marks in important metrics that will catch the public's attention and attract new customers to your company.

Customer service personalization

The first step to good customer service is personalization. Generic answers may not only fail to solve the user's problem but also irritate them. It is therefore important to go into detail about each consumer's specific case and understand their situation. In order to do this, some tips for customer service representatives include:

  • Put yourself in the customer's shoes: how would you like to be treated if you were in the consumer's situation? Empathy is essential in customer service;
  • Ask questions to get as much context as possible about the customer's situation;
  • Check all the information provided by the user and communicate clearly, politely and objectively with them.

For the company, on the other hand, it is important to:

  • Analyze data: use data analysis tools to better understand the behavior and preferences of each user and create detailed profiles. This way, it will be easier to offer personalized services based on each customer's history;
  • Have multiple channels: each customer will have a preferred method of communication. Providing multiple channels, therefore, increases the chances of your service being successful. Among the main channels are live chats, email, telephone, social networks and instant messaging applications. It is important to emphasize that all channels must be well integrated, so that the customer can switch between them without losing the conversation history.

Customer service evaluation

Customer service evaluation systems can also provide useful metrics. After a customer interacts with a company employee, ask them to rate the process and analyze the results.

Evaluations can provide insights not only into your customer service representatives, but also into your company. If complaints about a specific area of ​​your business are generating low ratings, it may need to be improved.

Fast and 24-hour service

In addition to being personalized, customer service must be fast and available at all times. iGaming users are active 24 hours a day, seven days a week, which means that customer service must be as well.

To achieve this, one option is to have customer support teams that can deal with user difficulties at any time, especially when it comes to financial and security issues. Since speed is also crucial to avoid frustration, live chat is one of the best options when it comes to talking to a player, as it allows you to provide real-time help. Integrating chatbots that can provide immediate automatic responses for simpler cases is also a valid strategy, as it frees up human agents for more complex cases.

Also remember to try to anticipate periods of high demand, such as major events and special promotions, to make additional resources available in the customer service area and, in this way, improve the time and quality of service.

Use of technology for customer service

Emerging technologies on the market can be used not only to develop a good iGaming platform, but also in customer service. Chatbots based on artificial intelligence are an example of this.

Automatic response systems help to respond to customers immediately, offer solutions for simple cases and forward complex cases to human agents. Chatbots developed by the company itself, as is the case with inplaySoft, are even more personalized and efficient.

In addition, artificial intelligence can be used to monitor, analyze and identify patterns that can improve customer service strategies. Checking the most common types of problems, for example, can lead to improvements in your platform.

Technologies also help to create clear and efficient systems for managing customer complaints and to develop intuitive platforms to facilitate navigation. Don't forget to ensure support on mobile devices, as a large number of players use their smartphones or tablets to access iGaming platforms.

Importance of customer service representatives

Customer service representatives are the pillars of customer service. Therefore, it is important to invest in ongoing training to keep them updated. They must be prepared to have in-depth knowledge of the company's products and policies, such as game rules, payment procedures and bonus policies. Knowing this information is essential for quickly and accurately resolving problems.

The proactivity and autonomy of the representatives is also essential for a quick resolution of the problem. Consulting other departments of the company to obtain answers takes time and the delays can leave the user dissatisfied.

Finally, a work environment where the representative feels happy is also important, as their tasks can be difficult and stressful. Support and trust between management and employees is essential.

In conclusion, fast and personalized customer service can ensure user satisfaction and loyalty. To do this, always have trained human service representatives available, but don't forget to count on technology to help you. And remember to show your customers that their opinion matters: listen to them and put their feed into action to ensure that your platform continues to improve. A well-served customer will be a satisfied and loyal customer.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Learn more about how your company can provide good customer service in the Brazilian market

item.title: Portugal, host of the 2024 SBC Summit, declares state of emergency due to wildfires
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
Lisbon, the capital of Portugal, will host the 2024 SBC Summit, which will take place between September 24 and 26. However, the country is in a state of emergency due to wildfires that are ravaging several regions.

Since last weekend, fires affected more than 10 thousand acres in the north and center of Portugal, between the regions of Porto and Aveiro. On Tuesday (17), André Fernandes, the country's national civil protection authority, stated that there were more than 65 active fires.

Fires affect Portugal’s population

The fires are affecting not only Portugal’s forest regions, but also the country’s population. For exemple, police closed the main road between Lisbon and Porto due to the risk of traveling through the region. The fires destroyed dozens of houses and, according to Fernandes, forced at least 70 residents of Aveiro to leave their homes over the past week. Many schools in Gondomar, near Porto, did not open on Tuesday due to the fires.

Local newspapers reported that hospitals in the affected regions are receiving a large number of people with burns, breathing difficulties and other symptoms related to the fires. 

“The situation is not out of control, but it is very complex,” said Fernandes.

Deaths in the fires

More than five thousand firefighters are battling the fires that are raging across Portugal. Sadly, three of them lost their lives in the battle in Tábua, Coimbra. Luís Montenegro, Portugal’s Prime Minister, said that the vehicle they were traveling in caught fire. However, he did not make it clear whether it had crashed beforehand. The accident also injured two other firefighters. 

Montenegro issued a note of condolence and said he was “deeply saddened” by the deaths of firefighters Sonia Cláudia Melo, Paulo Jorge Santos and Susana Cristina Carvalho.

EU helps combat the fires

Ursula von der Leyen, president of the European Commission since 2019, said the bloc was “urgently mobilizing” and urged other countries to help fight the fires in Portugal. The European Union (EU) already sent eight planes to help contain the blazes. 

Portugal also has 30 water bombing aircrafts and has mobilized more than 1,500 fire trucks to fight the fires. In a post on X, Montenegro thanked France, Greece, Italy and Spain for their “rapid and essential help in combating this plague”.

Global warming

Portugal and Spain have registered fewer fires this year, mainly due to a wet and rainy start of the year. However, these countries remain vulnerable to fires when the weather is dry and hot, which is also driven by global warming. Since the beginning of the industrial era, the planet's average temperature increased by around 1.1°C and is expected to continue rising in the coming years.

inplaySoft at the SBC Summit in Portugal

This year’s SBC Summit will take place in Lisbon, Portugal, from September 24 to 26. The event will bring together over 450 speakers and 600 exhibitors to discuss the latest developments in the iGaming industry.

InplaySoft will be on stand D110 to showcase its cutting-edge technology and tailored services specifically for iGaming operators, particularly those looking to capitalize on the newly regulated Brazilian market. Our platform offers a comprehensive suite of services, including sports betting, casino games and player protection tools. In addition, we also offer seamless integration with existing systems, giving operators the flexibility they need to manage their offerings.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: More than 65 fires have affected over 10 thousand acres in different regions of Portugal

item.title: How AI is revolutionizing the world of sports betting?
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
The world of sports betting is increasingly dominating both national and international markets. With advancements in artificial intelligence (AI), a transformation is underway. AI technology is evolving sports betting from a simple game of chance into a refined art of data-driven precision. This change is completely reshaping! Since how bettors engage, elevating them from mere spectators to strategic players, where data and algorithms redefine the odds.

The new era of sports betting

Traditionally, sports betting was driven by intuition, experience, and often pure luck. Now, AI is set to alter this landscape fundamentally. AI is revolutionary with its ability to analyze vast amounts of data and identify patterns. Most of it would be impossible for humans to discern, AI is becoming the new star in sports betting. It's not just about improving the odds of winning but transforming betting into a well-grounded, strategic endeavor.

The new crystal ball for betting

At the core of AI’s influence on sports betting is predictive analytics. Major companies like Stratagem and Stats Perform leverage AI to analyze historical data and more. Player statistics, and even weather conditions to predict game outcomes with impressive accuracy. For example, Stratagem uses advanced machine learning algorithms to turn data from thousands of past games into valuable betting strategies, giving bettors an edge that was previously unimaginable.

Sports betting, which previously relied somewhat on luck, is also becoming more personalized. Tools like BetBuddy use AI to offer betting suggestions tailored to individual styles and histories. This personalized approach ensures that each bettor receives recommendations aligned with their preferences and risk tolerance, making every bet a unique experience.

AI in Esports betting

The burgeoning market of esports betting is also experiencing a transformation due to AI. Algorithms are being refined to understand the intricacies of esports games. They provide insights and predictions for titles like Dota 2 and League of Legends. Companies such as Unikrn are at the forefront of this shift, offering AI-driven betting advice for the esports realm and opening new opportunities for bettors in this expanding sector.

Advantages of using AI

One of the most significant contributions of AI to sports betting is ensuring fairness. AI systems are increasingly being used to detect and prevent fraudulent activities and match-fixing. For example, Sportradar's Fraud Detection System (FDS) uses AI to analyze betting patterns and flag suspicious activities. That, helping maintain the integrity of both sports and betting.

Additionally, AI plays a crucial role in risk management and responsible gambling. Tools like PlayScan utilize AI to analyze gambling behaviors and identify risky patterns, providing alerts and resources to help bettors stay in control and ensure that betting remains a form of entertainment.

The process of setting odds, a crucial component of sports betting, has also been revolutionized by AI. Traditional methods of odds-setting are being supplemented, and in some cases replaced, by AI algorithms capable of processing a far greater number of variables and data points. This evolution is making the betting market more efficient and dynamic, benefiting both bookmakers and bettors.

Performance analysis and training

Interestingly, AI’s impact on sports betting also extends to team preparation and performance. AI tools are used to analyze player performance and develop game strategies, which can indirectly influence betting odds and outcomes. This broad impact of AI on both the game and betting adds a new layer of complexity and depth to sports betting.

As we move towards an increasingly technological future, we witness significant evolution in the sports world, largely due to the development of sports betting apps. Technology has played a crucial role in how audiences engage and participate in games, and AI is taking its first steps to further transform the sports industry.

The notion that sports betting is evolving from a simple game of chance to a data-driven precision practice is no longer just a theory. AI is at the forefront of this transformation, shaping the future of sports betting applications.

The importance of Artificial Intelligence in betting

The significance of AI is clear: its ability to automate processes, enhance efficiency, and foster innovation makes it an essential component of today’s digital transformation.

To better understand the impact of AI on sports betting, it’s important to dispel some myths. AI is revolutionizing the industry with advanced algorithms and machine learning techniques to analyze data and make precise predictions. One major impact of AI is in odds calculation, where algorithms process vast amounts of historical data and real-time information to provide accurate odds for upcoming events.

This level of innovation often requires the expertise of companies specializing in mobile application development, which create sophisticated platforms for sportsbooks. This innovation not only improves the efficiency of betting operators but also enhances the overall user experience. Additionally, fraud detection is another crucial area where AI tools identify suspicious patterns and signs of manipulation, ensuring the integrity of betting and preventing fraudulent behavior.

item.title: AI's game-changing impact on sports betting
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing sports betting in ways that were once unimaginable. Today, AI goes beyond simple algorithms, leveraging complex models to predict outcomes with unparalleled accuracy. Traditional odds, which depended on limited statistics and intuition, now benefit from AI’s ability to process vast amounts of real-time data. This includes player performance metrics, weather conditions, and historical game trends, providing sharper insights and more precise betting odds.

Personalization and efficiency redefined

AI’s impact extends beyond optimizing odds. It reshapes player engagement and operational efficiency. Advanced algorithms enhance risk management and detect fraud, minimizing losses and ensuring fairness. AI-driven chatbots offer instant customer support, resolving inquiries and issues swiftly, enhancing overall satisfaction.

Moreover, AI personalizes the betting experience by analyzing individual betting patterns, delivering customized offers and promotions. This tailored approach not only elevates the player experience but also fosters deeper engagement and loyalty.

Enhancing user experience

AI is redefining the entire betting experience, not just odds and predictions. Enhanced algorithms streamline risk management and quickly identify anomalies, significantly reducing fraud risks. For bettors, AI provides a personalized experience, analyzing individual behaviors and offering suggestions that align with personal preferences.

AI-powered chatbots and virtual assistants are revolutionizing customer service, providing immediate assistance and managing high interaction volumes efficiently. This real-time support improves user satisfaction and operational efficiency.

In sports betting, embracing AI’s evolving capabilities is essential. Its precision in analyzing data not only transforms odds calculations but also boosts overall user engagement and operational efficiency. As AI technology advances, its role in sports betting will continue to grow, setting new industry standards and shaping the future of the betting experience.

item.title: iGaming History: from the early days of the internet to a multi-billion dollar industry
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
iGaming refers to the online betting and gaming industry, which includes online casino games, sports betting, poker and other forms of gambling via the internet. The history of iGaming is fascinating, as it spans decades of technological innovation, legal changes and the gradual transformation of the gambling industry itself. In this article, inplaySoft will explore the evolution of iGaming, its technological advancements, legal challenges and its emergence as a multi-billion-dollar global industry.

Early Beginnings of iGaming

The history of iGaming begins in the early days of the internet in the 1990s. Traditional casinos, sports betting and lotteries were already well-established by this time, but the arrival of the internet set the stage for a new era of gambling.

The first notable step in the history of iGaming came in 1994 with the passing of the Free Trade & Processing Act in Antigua and Barbuda, a small Caribbean nation. This Act allowed the country to issue licenses to online gaming operators and was a significant milestone in legitimizing online gambling, allowing it to be legal across borders. Antigua became the first jurisdiction to offer online gambling licenses, making it a hub for iGaming companies.

In the same year, Microgaming, one of the first software providers for online casinos, was founded. Its development of software for online gaming platforms was critical in the launch of the first online casino, InterCasino, in 1996. Its launch was the beginning of a new era in gambling, as players could now enjoy traditional casino games such as blackjack, roulette and poker from the comfort of their own homes.

Technological Advances in iGaming

The early years of online casinos had a slow, but steady, growth, with only a handful of operators offering their services. The technology behind these early platforms was rudimentary, with basic graphics and simple interfaces. However, as the internet evolved and technology improved, so did the quality of the gaming experience.

One of the key advancements in iGaming technology came in the late 1990s with the development of Real-Time Gaming (RTG) and Cryptologic software. These providers brought advanced encryption technologies, secure payment systems and the ability to process large volumes of transactions. This increased security and trust in online gambling, attracting a growing number of players.

By the late 1990s and early 2000s, online casinos began to offer a wide variety of games, including slot machines, video poker and other table games. As the industry grew, so did competition among online casino operators. To attract more players, casinos began offering welcome bonuses, free spins, and loyalty programs, which further fueled the growth of the industry.

Sports Betting and Mobile Gaming

While online casinos and poker dominated the early days of iGaming, sports betting quickly emerged as one of the most lucrative sectors within the industry. As the internet became more widely accessible, sports fans discovered the convenience of placing bets on their favorite teams and events from the comfort of their own homes.

In the mid-2000s, the increasing adoption of smartphones and mobile devices ushered in a new era of iGaming. Mobile technology allowed players to access their favorite casino games, poker rooms and sports betting platforms on the go, leading to the rise of mobile gambling. Mobile apps for iGaming platforms quickly became a central part of the industry, offering more convenience and accessibility for users.

As mobile gaming expanded, so did the number of available games. In addition to traditional casino games, developers began to experiment with new formats, including live dealer games, which feature real dealers broadcasting games in real time from a casino studio, offering players an immersive experience similar to that of land-based casinos. 

Regulatory Changes and Legal Challenges

As the popularity of online gambling continued to grow, governments around the world began to take notice. The rapid expansion of the iGaming industry brought forth a range of legal challenges, as lawmakers sought to regulate the industry and protect consumers.

In the United States, online gambling faced significant legal hurdles, particularly with the passage of the Unlawful Internet Gambling Enforcement Act (UIGEA) in 2006. The UIGEA made it illegal for banks and financial institutions to process transactions related to online gambling, effectively shutting down a significant portion of the U.S. iGaming market. This led many major online gambling operators to exit the U.S. market, although some continued to operate in offshore jurisdictions.

In Europe, the regulatory environment for online gambling varied by country. The UK Gambling Commission, established in 2005, became one of the most prominent regulatory bodies for online gaming operators. Many European countries, including Spain, Italy and France, introduced national laws to regulate online gambling, offering licenses to operators and ensuring that consumer protection measures were in place.

Since then, many countries developed frameworks to regulate online gambling, leading to the legal expansion of iGaming in various regions. The legalization of online sports betting in the United States in 2018 marked another turning point for the industry, as it opened up a vast new market for iGaming companies.

The Future of iGaming

The iGaming industry came a long way since the launch of the first online casinos and poker rooms in the 1990s. Today it is a multi-billion-dollar industry that continues to evolve with advancements in technology, changing regulations and growing consumer demand.

One of the key trends shaping the future of iGaming is the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning into gaming platforms. These technologies can help improve user experiences, enhance security and create personalized gaming environments. Additionally, the rise of virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) is expected to offer even more immersive gaming experiences, further blurring the line between online and land-based gambling.

As more regions legalize and regulate online gambling, new markets will open up and competition within the industry will continue to grow. iGaming companies will likely focus on innovation, player retention and responsible gambling practices to stay ahead in an increasingly competitive market.

Final thoughts

The history of iGaming is a story of technological innovation, legal challenges and the transformation of the gambling industry. From the early days of online casinos in the 1990s to the rise of mobile gaming, poker and sports betting, iGaming underwent significant growth and evolution. As the industry continues to mature, the future of iGaming looks bright, with new technologies and regulatory frameworks poised to shape the next phase of the industry’s development.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: iGaming History: from the early days to a multi-billion dollar industry
Learn more about the evolution of iGaming, from the first online casinos to the current increasingly competitive market!

item.title: Municipal bets could make a big impact in the economy of Brazil generating more than US$ 2 billion in revenue
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
Municipal bets have the potential to generate over R$ 11.6 billion (or US$ 2 billion) per year for Brazil’s federal government. The number was obtained by Leme Consultores after a survey commissioned by the National Association of Municipal and State Lotteries (Analome), and published by Estadão newspaper. 

The research estimates that almost R$ 8 billion (or US$ 1.4 billion) could come from small and medium-sized operators that are currently outside the formal system because they are unable to bear the costs of the federal license. Cities, in theory, could grant “municipal licenses” which would be cheaper and would encourage these companies to enter the formal system. And, with legalized operations, the companies would start paying taxes, which would go to the federal government.

“The time has come to ensure respect for municipal autonomy and disseminate good practices regarding the regulation of lottery activity in Brazil,” said Sofia Signorelli, Analome’s legal director, in an interview for Estadão.

Brazil’s Current Betting Legal Framework

In 2018, Brazil approved Law No. 13.756/2018 and legalized fixed-odds sports betting as a lottery modality. This law allowed both online and physical operations, but left the implementation up to the Ministry of Finance, now under the Ministry of Economy. In 2023, the country’s government approved Provisional Measure No. 1.182/2023 and the subsequent Law No. 14.790/2023, which began to concretely regulate online sports betting and iGaming, and established operational guidelines and tax structures.

Today, under federal law:

  • Operators must be authorized by the Ministry of Finance.
  • A licensing fee of R$ 30 million allows operators to function for five years.
  • Operators can only work if they have a Brazilian legal entity with headquarters in Brazil.
  • The federal government imposes a 12% gross gaming revenue (GGR) tax on betting operators.
  • Bettors are subject to a 15% income tax on net winnings above R$ 2,112.

Municipal and State-Level Involvement

While federal law dominates gambling regulation, Brazilian states and municipalities retain authority over state lotteries, after a 2020 Supreme Court decision that removed the federal monopoly. As a result, several states, such as Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo, and Minas Gerais, have launched their own state lottery systems.

However, municipal governments have not been widely included in this framework. Local governments typically lack the legislative clarity and financial means to establish betting systems independently. Municipal bets, understood as betting schemes operated or licensed by city governments, remain legally ambiguous and practically non-existent.

What Are Municipal Bets?

Municipal bets could include:

  • Local event betting, for example on municipal sports tournaments, cultural events, or local talent shows.
  • Small-scale digital lotteries hosted by the city.
  • Bingo, raffles, or keno-style games tied to local infrastructure or charity funding.

These systems would be modeled to stay within legal bounds, avoid competition with federal and state lotteries, and be customized to local populations. Furthermore, municipal bets could be administered directly by city governments or through private-public partnerships with regulated operators.

Economic Potential of Municipal Bets

Among the economic potentials of municipal bets are:

  • Boosting Federal Revenue via Shared Taxation

Although the bets would be managed at the municipal level, the federal government could impose a national tax rate or revenue-sharing model. For instance:

  • A fixed federal participation fee or royalty from licensed operators.
  • Inclusion of municipal operators under the existing 15% tax on player winnings.
  • A small revenue-sharing agreement where a percentage of gross revenue from municipal betting is transferred to the federal treasury.

This could parallel the model used in federal-state lottery revenue-sharing agreements in countries like the United States and Germany. If just 10% of Brazil’s 5,570 municipalities implemented such systems and generated an average monthly GGR of R$ 200,000, the annual revenue would be R$ 133 million per year. This is a conservative estimate, assuming modest uptake and minimal stakes. Realistic expansion and better digital adoption could triple or quadruple these figures.

  • Stimulating Local Economies

Legalized municipal betting could also:

  • Fund public health, education, and culture via earmarked revenues.
  • Support local job creation in digital operations, regulation, and compliance.
  • Encourage financial inclusion, particularly in underbanked areas, through digital wallet and micro-transaction adoption linked to betting apps.

Advantages of Legalizing Municipal Bets

Some of the main advantages of legalizing municipal bets include:

  • Decentralized Revenue Generation

By empowering municipalities to operate their own betting services, the national government can encourage decentralized, bottom-up revenue generation. Cities would have the incentive to innovate, market, and grow their platforms, reducing dependency on federal transfers.

  • Improved Regulatory Oversight

Currently, much of the betting in Brazil occurs through unlicensed or offshore operators, with billions of reais flowing out of the country. Legalizing municipal bets could localize compliance and enforcement, allowing municipalities to control operations and crack down on illegal betting. Also, it could ensure better data collection, enabling policymakers to track gambling trends and reduce problem gambling.

  • Integration with Smart Cities and Digital Governance

Municipal betting platforms could be integrated into broader smart city initiatives, using digital wallets, local identity verification, and e-governance platforms. Municipalities like Curitiba or Campinas, known for digital innovation, could pilot such systems and provide templates for national rollout.

In an interview for Estadão, Menndel Macedol, tax expert, said that “ regulating bets at the municipal level is recognizing an economic reality that already exists and that has even been the subject of federal regulation. Denying municipalities this power violates the principle of autonomy and delays the use of a legitimate source of public revenue. It is an intelligent, modern measure that does not increase the tax burden on those who already contribute”.

Challenges and Considerations

Despite the potential of municipal bets, some hurdles remain:

  • Legal reforms: current federal legislation does not explicitly allow for municipal betting systems. A new law or amendment would be necessary to authorize cities to license and tax betting.
  • Regulatory capacity: smaller municipalities may lack the expertise to regulate betting operations. Federal or state-level support could be essential.
  • Gambling addiction concerns: as with all gaming expansions, responsible gambling programs and public health monitoring must accompany any legalization.

Final thoughts

Legalizing and regulating municipal betting in Brazil could unlock a significant, currently untapped source of revenue. By developing a framework that allows local governments to create and license betting operations, under national oversight and revenue-sharing models, the federal government can enhance its fiscal base while empowering municipalities. In a country where informal betting is widespread and digital adoption is accelerating, now is the time to move toward a regulated, inclusive, and mutually beneficial municipal betting ecosystem.

Contact inplaySoft

Brazil is one of inplaySoft’s priorities. We recognize the country’s potential to be among the largest iGaming markets in the world and we are fully tailored for its regulations. We are currently the provider of important brazilian brands such as GingaBet, QGBet, Viva Sorte, and 4Win, and aim to increase even more our presence in country. So if you want to change your current provider, start an online casino or sports betting platform, or know more about us, click here to visit inplaySoft’s website or contact us at sales@inplaysoft.com!
