item.title: What are the best strategies to keep customers loyal in iGaming?
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
Attracting new customers is a fundamental part of iGaming, but keeping them loyal is an increasingly important mission. In an industry that has grown exponentially in recent years, strategies to ensure that users remain engaged, satisfied and do not seek out other competitors are essential.

Personalization: customers are unique

Personalizing services is one of the main strategies to keep your customers engaged. Offering different experiences according to each user's profile can be what makes your company unique in the market.

The main personalization strategies include:

  • Offering personalized bonuses: it is important to offer bonuses that align with each customer's profile. To do this, you can use data on user behavior to better understand their profile and, in this way, personalize your offers.
  • Segmenting communication: sending the same messages to all customers is not an efficient way to keep them engaged. According to each user's preferences and activities, you can notify them of interesting promotions, such as new games, bonus updates or exclusive offers.
  • Personalizing recommendations: based on each customer's history and preferences, you can create personalized recommendations for new games.

Loyalty programs

Loyalty programs are also customizable customer retention strategies. This tactic is based on rewarding users’ loyalty with benefits and privileges, and can include:

  • Points and levels: providing points based on each player’s activity, so that the higher their score, the higher their level, or status. Players with higher levels can also have additional benefits, such as exclusive and personalized bonuses.
  • Refunds: offering refunds provides security and can encourage users to play again.
  • Exclusive promotions for members: offers can be personalized based on the user’s profile.

Gamification

In addition to personalizing services, gamification is also one of the most powerful tools for engaging and retaining your customers. This means applying game elements to non-game contexts and can include:

  • Creating engaging challenges and missions: reward your users for completing specific tasks and achieving certain goals.
  • Offering rankings and leaderboards: promote friendly competitions between players, in which the winners climb the rankings.
  • Organize events and tournaments: provide social and competitive experiences.

User experience and customer service

To keep your customers loyal, it is also important to provide them with a good experience and service. iGaming platforms must offer attractive designs, easy navigation and intuitive features. To achieve this goal, the game interface must prioritize:

  • Responsiveness: the game must be responsive and work on mobile devices, as many players currently access iGaming via smartphones and tablets.
  • Fast loading: the loading time of pages and games must be as short as possible to avoid frustration.
  • User-friendly navigation: menus must be clear and provide quick access to games and their main features.

If users face any type of problem or have questions about your platform, good customer service will be essential to keep them loyal. To this end, it is recommended to have:

  • 24-hour customer service: your customer must be able to reach you 24 hours a day, seven days a week, so that they can resolve their problem at any time.
  • More than one support channel: each player will have their own preference regarding the channel to resolve their issue, so it is important to provide several support channels, such as live chat, email and telephone.
  • Quick resolution: problems should be resolved as quickly as possible to avoid frustration.

Other customers retention strategies

To keep your customers satisfied, good practices include a feedback system so that they can give their opinion on the strengths and weaknesses of your platform. In this sense, it is possible to:

  • Promote satisfaction surveys to better understand what the user experience is like and identify which aspects of your platform can be improved.
  • Analyze data to understand player behavior and identify patterns that may indicate problems.
  • Respond to feedback, implement improvements and communicate changes to highlight the value of your customer's opinion.

Finally, it is essential that your platform offers security to your customers and complies with all legal regulations, both in your country and internationally. To do this:

  • Provide good systems for verifying user identity and potential money laundering schemes.
  • Have the appropriate licenses to operate legally.
  • Provide data protection to protect and handle your customers’ personal and financial information with the utmost security.

Keeping your iGaming customers loyal is a complex challenge, but by adopting the strategies above you will increase your chances of building a loyal and engaged user base. Always remember that your goal is not only to attract new players and keep them active, but also to provide personalized experiences that are safe and rewarding.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Attracting new customers is important, but keeping them engaged and loyal can be even more

item.title: What are the best bonuses for sports betting and casino games?
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
In the competitive world of online betting, one of the main strategies for both attracting new customers and retaining them is to offer bonuses. It is natural for players to look for the platform where their investment will have the best chance of turning into profits, and bonuses often influence the choice of where to invest their money.

That is why in this article we will analyze the best bonuses for both sports betting and casino games.

Sports Betting Bonuses

Welcome Bonuses

The chances of you returning to a place increase when you are well received, don't you think? Therefore, welcome bonuses are important not only to attract new players, but also to keep them loyal to your platform.

These gratifications can be either a specific amount that the user receives when creating their account or a percentage relative to their first deposit. It is possible, for example, to offer a 100% bonus when the player invests their first R$100, which means that the platform will give R$100 in bonuses, totaling R$200 for the user to bet.

Free Bets

Whether part of the welcome package or not, many platforms offer free bets. This bonus allows the player to bet without risking their own money and, if they win, the profit is usually credited as real money to the user’s account.

Risk Free Bets

Risk-free bets are those in which if you lose, you get your money back, usually in the form of betting credit. This type of bonus can also be part of the welcome package, as it reduces the initial risk for the player and gives them an extra chance to use the platform again without losing money.

Reloading Bonuses

Reload bonuses, on the other hand, aim to keep your customer loyal. They are offered from the second deposit and are usually smaller than welcome bonuses. They usually correspond to a percentage of the investment to encourage the player to continue betting.

Increased Odds

Many players are always looking for bets with the best odds, that is, with the highest possible return on their investment. Therefore, as part of specific promotions or events, many platforms offer increased odds, which increases the bettor's profit potential, thus attracting a larger number of users.

Casino Games Bonuses

Welcome Bonuses

Welcome bonuses for casino games are similar to those for sports betting and can also be a fixed amount or correspond to a percentage of the first deposit. Here, however, there is the possibility of offering the player free spins on some games. Certain platforms provide, for example, 50 free spins on slot games, which encourages the user to get to know and try this modality.

Free Spins

As mentioned above, free spins encourage players to play certain games, such as slots or roulette. They allow users to play a certain number of times without risking their own money, and the winnings can either be credited to your account or subject to certain restrictions, such as having to be spent on new bets.

No Deposit Bonuses

No deposit bonuses are among the most sought after by players. They allow the user to play and win money without having to make an initial deposit on the platform. However, this bonus usually has higher wagering requirements and stricter restrictions.

Reload Bonuses

Just like sports betting platforms, many casino games offer bonuses from the second deposit onwards to keep their customers loyal. In addition to a cash amount, it is also possible to offer free spins.

Loyalty and VIP Programs

While attracting new players to your platform is essential, retaining them is also essential. For this, there are loyalty programs. These rewards reward loyal users with points that can be exchanged for bonuses, cash or other rewards. VIP players, on the other hand, can have access to exclusive bonuses, personalized promotions and priority customer service.

How do you know if a bonus is worth it?

Now that we know the main bonuses offered by sportsbooks and casinos, let's analyze which ones are really worth it for players.

Wagering Requirements (Rollover)

Wagering requirements, also known as rollovers, are the number of times a player must wager the bonus amount (or the combined amount of the bonus and deposit) before they can withdraw any winnings.

If a platform offers a bonus of R$200 but has a wagering requirement of 30x, for example, the player will need to wager a total of R$6,000 before they can withdraw winnings related to the bonus. In other words, the lower the rollover, the better for the player.

Withdrawal Limits

Bonuses often also have a withdrawal limit. This means that there is a maximum amount that a player can withdraw after meeting the wagering requirements, which imposes a limit and restricts the amount that they can win from a bonus.

Some platforms also set deadlines for withdrawing the amount won, which means that the player needs to pay attention to withdraw their money by, or after, a certain date.

How to make the most of the bonuses?

Finally, for players looking to make the most of the bonuses offered by sports betting platforms and casinos, some tips include:

  • Research and compare bonuses offered by different platforms. You can do this by using comparison sites and player forums.
  • Understand the prerequisites and any other conditions associated with the bonus.
  • Take advantage of temporary promotions and special offers.

Which bonuses does inplayBet offer?

InplayBet offers several types of bonuses to its customers, such as:

  • Welcome bonuses, which include up to R$500 on your first deposit for sports betting and 10 free spins on casino games;
  • Free bets;
  • Cashback;
  • Exclusive events and promotions.

Offering bonuses is a strategy that can be beneficial both for platforms, who attract new customers, and for players, who have a chance to increase their profits. For platforms, it is important to remember the importance of not only gaining new users, but also keeping them satisfied; for players, do not forget about the terms and conditions, and bet responsibly.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Offering bonuses to players is one of the best strategies to attract and retain customers

item.title: What are the recent changes in Brazil's iGaming legislation, their impacts and benefits?
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
They took Brazil by storm in recent years and seem to be everywhere we look, from television advertisements to football team shirts. The popularity of sports betting houses in the country increased so much that led to changes in the Brazil's iGaming legislation in 2023.

But what were they and what were their impacts and benefits, both for players and for the betting houses themselves?

Changes in Brazil's iGaming legislation

In December 2023, Brazil approved Law 14.790/23. Among the main changes imposed by it, private companies will now be able to operate sports betting both online and in physical establishments.

See, below, how this Law will affect sports betting in the country:

  • Private companies will be able to operate both online and in physical establishments: until December 2023, sports betting in Brazil was only allowed in lottery shops and was controlled by the federal government. As of January of this year, however, any private company will be able to operate sports betting, whether digitally or in a physical space.
  • The minimum age for placing sports bets has increased from 18 to 21 years old.
  • Advertisements or any type of publicity targeted at minors have been prohibited.
  • Betters must have their identity verified and validated;
  • Bookmakers must implement policies to prevent money laundering schemes and promote responsible gambling.

How will sports betting regulation work in Brazil?

It is important to note that, in 2023, Brazil also approved Provisional Measure (MP) No. 1.182/2023, amending Law 13.756/18. Among other changes, this law allows for more control of the sports betting sector. For example:

  • Monitoring: betting houses will have to purchase a license to operate in Brazil. The tendency is for a new department to be created in the Ministry of Finance to accredit companies, after a process of document analysis. If approved, the government will monitor the volume of bets and the institutions' revenue, which will ensure more control over this market.
  • Legality: companies approved in the process mentioned above and with valid licenses will be able to receive bets related to sporting events. These events, however, must be official and organized by federations, leagues or confederations. The government will fine betting houses that commit infractions between 0.1% and 20% of the proceeds of the revenue, depending on the severity of the violation.
  • Taxes: players with winnings exceeding R$2,112 will have to pay 30% of the value of their total winnings in taxes, which is the same rate applied to lottery prizes. Betting houses, in turn, must be required to pay an 18% tax on Gross Gaming Revenue (GGR), which is the revenue obtained from all games played, minus prizes paid to players and taxes levied on legal entities. Companies in the sector, like any other, will also need to pay PIS, Cofins, Income Tax, CSLL and ISS.
  • Money laundering: betting houses must implement strict control and effective monitoring systems to prevent money laundering. They must submit information about bettors to the Financial Activities Control Council (Coaf).

Bookmakers will also need to promote awareness-raising actions regarding pathological gambling disorder, to prevent addiction and ensure the mental health of bettors.

Who won't be able to bet?

According to the new regulations, the following people will not be able to bet:

  • People under the age of 21;
  • Public agents who oversee the sector at federal level;
  • People with access to computerized fixed-odds lottery betting systems;
  • People who may have influence on the results of games, such as coaches, referees and athletes;
  • People registered in national credit protection registries.

Benefits of Brazil's iGaming legislation changes

Changes in Brazilian sports betting legislation will bring several challenges, including ensuring security for users and adapting to the General Data Protection Law (LGPD).

However, they can bring benefits to both bettors and bookmakers and the Brazilian government. For instance:

  • Legal security: bookmakers based abroad do not run the risk of being subject to sanctions for operating in Brazil, but not being physically present in the country.
  • Revenue: with regulation, the Brazilian government will be able to collect taxes from the operations.
  • Job creation: with the exponential growth of the industry, the trend for the future is the creation of thousands of jobs in the area.
  • Reliability: with regulation, bettors tend to trust bookmakers more, which will have to implement mandatory security measures to prevent fraud and scams.
  • Better identification of users: the trust of bookmakers in the bettors themselves will also increase, since they will go through identity validation processes.
  • Reduced risk of crime: since the legislation now requires bookmakers to identify and validate the identity of users, and to implement security measures, the chances of identity fraud, money laundering, among other virtual crimes, decrease.

Market opportunity for sports betting houses

The biggest challenge for bookmakers in Brazil was trust in the sector. According to a study carried out by the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) in 2022, Brazil was the country in Latin America and the Caribbean where people least trusted both other people and institutions. The distrust was even greater when it came to sports betting - a study carried out by Sportradar showed that Brazil was the world leader in the ranking of suspected fraud in sports betting that year.

However, with changes in legislation and regulation, trust in bookmakers should increase and the sector could grow even more. In 2020, the sports betting segment had a value of US$ 59.6 billion worldwide. The prediction is that, by 2027, this number will increase to US$ 127.3 billion.

Considering the fact that, with a population of over 215 million people, Brazil is the seventh most populous country on the planet, regulating sports betting opens up a huge market opportunity for bookmakers. It will only be important to follow the regulations, increase security and bet responsibly.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Brazil's iGaming legislation now allows private companies to operate sports betting

item.title: Data security in digital businesses: common threats and how to avoid them
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
The exponential increase in the number of digital businesses in recent years has resulted in an equally intense increase in cybercrime. Data security, for example, is a concern for all companies operating on the internet. For the iGaming sector, the issue is especially sensitive, since it is not only the customer’s information that is at risk, but also their money.

Therefore, in this article we will address the most common threats to digital security and the best practices that can be adopted to prevent them.

Common Data Security Threats

There is a wide variety of threats to the user data security in digital business which are constantly evolving to increasingly confuse people and security systems. Some of the most commons one include:

  • Phishing attacks: fraudulent emails that trick users into obtaining personal information. Knowing how to identify these emails is essential to avoid falling into the traps.
  • Malware: malicious software that can invade systems, steal data or block access to accounts. To reduce the risk of these attacks, it is important to keep your software updated and use reliable antivirus software.
  • Internal threats and data leaks: employees with access to user data can compromise security, not only intentionally, but also through carelessness. To prevent this from happening, you can implement access controls, encryption, regular audits and data access management.

How to protect user data?

Among the best practices to ensure user data security, companies can implement:

  • Strong encryption, to ensure that even if criminals intercept data, it remains inaccessible to unauthorized users.
  • Regular security audits, to help identify vulnerabilities and fix flaws before they can be exploited.
  • Two-factor authentication (2FA), to add an extra layer of security by requiring users to verify their identity using two different methods.
  • Collecting only the information necessary for business operations, to reduce exposure in the event of a data breach.
  • Incident response plans, which should include communication strategies to inform affected users.
  • Regular software updates, to protect against known vulnerabilities.
  • User awareness, such as creating strong passwords and knowing how to identify phishing attempts.

Importance of data security

Data security is important not only for users, but also for businesses. Ensuring that your customers’ information is handled responsibly will increase people’s trust in your business, just as a data breach, for example, can ruin a business’s reputation.

In addition, cyberattacks can cause significant disruptions to a company’s operations, resulting in financial and customer losses. Finally, failure to comply with the guidelines of the General Data Protection Law (LGPD) in Brazil can result in fines and legal sanctions.

Data security at inplaySoft

inplaySoft gives the highest priority to the security of its users' data, providing advanced measures to ensure the confidentiality of its players' information. Among these measures, we can mention:

  • KYC and AML tools to verify and validate users’ identities.
  • Risk and anti-fraud tools that provide robust protection against fraud and malicious attempts to disrupt normal traffic.
  • Verification systems that prevent criminal from using the platform for money laundering.

inplaySoft is also following all the new regulations for iGaming imposed by the Brazilian legislation in 2023, according to Law 14.790/23. In this way, our platform guarantees an experience that is not only rewarding for its users, but also safe and reliable.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: With digital crimes on the rise, data security is essential for both users and businesses

item.title: What are the key metrics for online casinos?
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
How is my business doing? This question, asked by business owners of all types around the world, is essential to know whether their current strategy is working or whether they need adjustments to improve. In online casinos, it is no different. To get an answer, we can rely on some key metrics, which give us an overview of how the business is doing.

In this article, we will explain what are the most important metrics for online casinos. We will divide them into four main groups: revenue, players, marketing and operational metrics.

Revenue metrics

The revenue metrics are those that help you understand whether your business is generating profits and how much you are earning. Among them, we can include:

Gross Gaming Revenue (GGR)

Gross gaming revenue is the total amount of money your business makes after subtracting the total amount paid out in winnings to players. If your online casino has at least a 10% increase in GGR per year, you don’t need to worry. Numbers below this percentage indicate that your business can improve.

Net Gaming Revenue (NGR)

The net gaming revenue, on the other hand, is the total amount of money your business makes after subtracting bonuses, promotional costs, and other player incentives. This metric provides a more accurate picture of your business’s profits and should grow by at least 5% per year.

Average Revenue Per User (ARPU)

This metric tells the company how much profit it makes on average from each player. Making between $100 and $200 per month per user is healthy for most online casinos.

Player metrics

These metrics seek to understand user behavior, engagement and retention.

Player retention rate

This metric is the percentage of users who continue to visit your online casino over a given period of time. The higher this number, the more loyal and satisfied your players are. If your retention rate is above 70% over a one-month period, you have nothing to worry about. If the number is lower, your business may need to adopt more interesting strategies to keep your players engaged and loyal.

Churn rate

Churn rate indicates the percentage of players who have stopped using your online casino in a given period of time. A low number in this metric is a sign that your users are engaged and satisfied. A rate below 5% in a month is excellent.

Player lifetime value (LTV)

Player lifetime value is the total expected profit per user, on average, over the course of their entire experience at your online casino. This metric, when compared to the customer acquisition cost (CAC), which we will explain next, will give you an idea of ​​how profitable your user base is. Your business should aim for an LTV that is around 3 to 4 times higher than your CAC.

Marketing metrics

Marketing metrics are important for evaluating the success of your campaigns and understanding how your casino is attracting and converting new players.

Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC)

This metric indicates how much your company spends, on average, to acquire a new player. The lower this number, the more effective your marketing campaigns are - a CAC of less than $200 is generally considered effective for most online casinos.

Return On Investment (ROI)

The Return On Investment is calculated by dividing the profit by the marketing costs. The higher this number, the more effective your marketing campaigns are - a ROI of 5:1, or five dollars earned for every dollar spent, is considered an indicator of success.

First-Time Depositors (FTD)

The metrics measures the proportion of new users who convert into first-time depositors. A conversion rate higher than 20% usually indicates that your online casino is successful.

Operational metrics

Operational metrics indicate the efficiency and effectiveness of the services offered by your online casino.

Downtime

Downtime is the period of time that your casino platform is unavailable to players. Ideally, your services should be available more than 99.9% of the time, meaning that your downtime should be less than 9 hours per year.

Transaction speed

Transaction speed refers to the time it takes for players to deposit or withdraw money. The faster transactions are completed, the more satisfied customers are. Online casinos should process deposits instantly and offer withdrawals within 24 hours.

Customer support response time

Customer support response times are crucial to keeping your players loyal. Ideally, you should respond to users within an hour and resolve their issues within 24 hours.


For online casino owners, it is important to constantly monitor these metrics and compare their progress over time. This way, you will be able to see which areas of your business are performing well and which need adjustments to improve. Remember that the goal of your business is to generate profit, but to achieve this, it is essential not only to attract new customers, but also to keep them engaged and satisfied for as long as possible.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Want to know how your online casino is doing? Understand the key metrics that can give you the answer

item.title: Importance of CRM platforms in Brazil's iGaming industry
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
In Brazil's rapidly expanding iGaming market, customer relationship management (CRM) platforms have become essential tools for companies looking to achieve a competitive advantage. A well-implemented CRM system not only optimizes operations but also elevates customer experiences, fosters loyalty, and drives revenue growth. The diverse and distinct nature of the Brazilian market requires tailored CRM strategies that resonate with local audiences while adhering to regulatory considerations and cultural nuances. 

Understanding CRM in the iGaming context 

CRM platforms in Brazil in the iGaming industry extend beyond traditional customer service functionalities. They enable operators to capture and analyze large volumes of player data, including preferences, engagement patterns, and transaction histories. This data is crucial for creating personalized experiences and targeted marketing campaigns that appeal to Brazilian bettors. Given the intense competition and the dynamic nature of the iGaming market, the ability to deliver relevant and timely content is a must. 

In Brazil, where bettors are known for their enthusiasm and loyalty, a personalized approach can significantly impact an operator’s success. CRM platforms allow iGaming companies to build detailed customer profiles, segment audiences based on behavior, and tailor promotions that resonate with each segment. For example, a bettor who frequently engages in live sports betting may respond positively to real-time updates and exclusive offers on upcoming events. This level of personalization enhances engagement and fosters long-term loyalty. 

Compliance and data security: The role of CRM in Brazil's regulatory landscape 

Navigating Brazil's regulatory environment is a critical aspect for any iGaming operator. With the potential regulation of sports betting and other forms of online gambling, operators must prioritize compliance and data security. CRM platforms can be configured to ensure that all customer interactions and data storage meet the latest regulatory requirements. This includes implementing features like automated age verification, responsible gambling tools, and secure data encryption. 

Data security is particularly important in Brazil due to the country’s General Data Protection Law (LGPD), which imposes strict requirements on how companies collect, store, and process personal information. An effective CRM platform should include built-in compliance features that not only protect customer data but also provide transparency and control to users. This builds trust and credibility, which are essential for attracting and retaining Brazilian customers in the highly competitive iGaming space. 

Enhancing player engagement and retention 

A primary benefit of a robust CRM system is its ability to enhance player engagement and retention. In the Brazilian iGaming market, where bettors constantly seek excitement and new experiences, a CRM platform helps operators stay ahead by delivering personalized content that keeps players engaged. This might include tailored welcome bonuses, VIP programs, and customized game recommendations. 

For instance, operators can use CRM data to identify high-value players and offer them exclusive promotions or early access to new features. By segmenting customers based on their betting habits, operators can create targeted campaigns that resonate with each group, whether they are casual players or high-stakes bettors. 

CRM as a tool for personalized marketing 

Personalization is key in Brazil’s iGaming sector, where a one-size-fits-all approach often falls short. With a well-structured CRM system, operators can design campaigns that cater to the preferences and behaviors of different player segments. This might include sending personalized messages or offering bonuses based on previous betting activities. Such targeted efforts are more likely to capture the attention of Brazilian bettors and lead to higher conversion rates. 

Leveraging CRM platforms in Brazil to understand customer behavior 

The ability to understand customer behavior is one of the most powerful aspects of CRM platforms. For iGaming companies in Brazil, this means being able to predict trends, identify preferences, and anticipate customer needs. A deep understanding of the audience allows operators to develop strategies that align with players’ expectations, increasing satisfaction and engagement. 

By leveraging CRM data, operators can also identify potential risks, such as problem gambling behaviors, and implement early interventions. This proactive approach not only supports responsible gambling initiatives but also helps maintain a positive reputation in the Brazilian market. 

Boosting operational efficiency with CRM 

CRM platforms in Brazil are not just about customer engagement; they also streamline various operational processes, making them invaluable tools for iGaming companies in Brazil. From automating marketing campaigns to managing customer inquiries, a CRM platforms in Brazil system reduces the burden on human resources and minimizes the risk of errors. 

Additionally, CRM platforms provide operators with a comprehensive view of their business, enabling them to monitor performance, track key metrics, and make data-driven decisions. This level of insight is essential for optimizing strategies and staying competitive in Brazil's fast-paced iGaming landscape. 

The importance of localization 

Brazil is a diverse market with unique cultural and social dynamics. Therefore, a successful CRM strategy must consider localization factors to resonate with the local audience. This includes offering support in Portuguese, understanding local betting preferences, and creating promotions that align with Brazilian holidays and events. 

A CRM system with localization features enables operators to communicate effectively with players, building stronger connections and fostering loyalty. Localization also adapts content and offers to reflect regional differences, making the experience more relevant and engaging for Brazilian users

Future trends in CRM platforms in Brazil's iGaming industry 

As Brazil's iGaming industry continues to grow, CRM platforms will evolve in response to new trends and technologies. Advanced analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence will play a bigger role in optimizing customer relationships and enhancing the overall player experience.

Operators investing in innovative CRM solutions will be better equipped to navigate the complexities of the Brazilian market, maintain compliance, and deliver exceptional service. As demand for personalization and real-time engagement rises, effectively leveraging CRM tools will become a key differentiator.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Importance of CRM platforms in Brazil iGaming industry

item.title: iGaming software providers: an in-depth analysis of the main companies in the market
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
For any company that wants to start an iGaming business in today’s competitive market, one of the main choices they will have to make is their software provider. With many options available, it is difficult to know which one might be the best fit for their enterprise. 

In this article, we will compare the main iGaming software providers: what are the advantages, disadvantages and options offered by each one? We will analyze their sportsbooks, set-up times and options regarding customization, hosting, gamification and bonuses. 

inplaySoft 

Based in London, inplaySoft was founded in 2020 and is specialized in providing cutting-edge iGaming solutions tailored to meet the dynamic needs of today's gaming operators. The company has a fully compliant KYC and document checks worldwide and is also fully tailored for the existing and upcoming Brazilian regulations. It is a multi-tenant platform, with which the clients can manage multiple brands from the same backoffice. 

inplaySoft has an in-house development team that can fully customize the platform to suit the client's needs. The customization for casino game descriptions and banners includes a field for meta-descriptions, to increase chances of ranking higher on google searches. 

Instead of using aggregators for casino games, the company integrates with each game provider directly, giving them access to up-to-date games, bonuses, offers, competitions and other extras at all times.    

inplaySoft uses Sportsradar as sportsbook feed provider and as sportsbook risk management. Furthermore, the company also has an in-house made risk management. The set-up time is one of the fastest among all companies in the market, ranging from two to three weeks for basic implementation. For hosting, inplaySoft uses different cloud systems, which have an uptime of over 99.99%, and is able to meet any scalability demands. 

inplaySoft also offers a full gamification suite, which includes tournaments, rankings and leaderboards, so clients have access to a complete customer retention arsenal. Among other bonuses, the company offers free spins, cashback, free bets and no risk bets. 

inplaySoft’s CRM marketing gives the client full control of customer's activity throughout the site, with an easy-to-use emailing and SMS system. They also have a CMS system which allows easy customization of banners, placement of modules and offers, games and sportsbooks. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Sportsradar. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: in-house and Sportsradar. 
  • Set-up Time: 2 to 3 weeks for basic implementation. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Hosting: Cloud (AWS). 
  • Gamification: full gamification suite, including tournaments, rankings, leaderboards. 
  • Bonuses: First deposit bonuses, including wager sport bonus and free spins; cashback; free bet; and no risk bet. 
  • CRM Marketing: CRM system that gives full control of customer's activity throughout the site, with an easy-to-use emailing and SMS system. CMS system that allows easy customization of banners, placement of modules and offers, games and sportsbooks. 

GammaStack 

GammaStack has over 13 years of experience in software development for sports betting, online casinos, game development, live dealer casinos and fantasy sports. The company can build platforms from scratch and customize them according to what the clients want. Since their foundation, they have developed more than 100 games and finished over 600 projects in 45 countries around the world. 

GammaStack uses Betradar and Lsports as their sportsbook feed provider and have both third parties and in-house made sportsbook risk management. Their set-up time can take from one to two months, but can increase depending on the level of customization the client wants. They have customizable gamification and bonuses options, as well as CRM and CMS marketing. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Betradar and Lsports. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: Inhouse and 3rd party. 
  • Set-up Time: One to two months. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Hosting: Cloud (AWS). 
  • Gamification: Customizable gamification options. 
  • Bonuses: Customizable bonus options. 
  • CRM Marketing: GammaStack has marketing CRM options and CMS. 

BetConstruct 

BetConstruct has been on the market for over 20 years offering Online and Retails Sportsbook, Classic Casino and Live Casino, Poker, Skill Games, Social Gaming Platform and Sports Data Solutions. The company is part of SoftConstruct, which currently has over 6 thousand employees and 16 branch offices operating around the world.

BetConstruct offers from stand-alone setups to white label solutions. They have their own sportsbook feed provider and sportsbook risk management. Their set-up time ranges from two to four months and they offer gamification and bonuses options made in-house. The company also offers CRM marketing options, but it comes as an additional product that can cost up to one thousand euros per month. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: BetConstruct. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: BetConstruct has its own risk management software. 
  • Set-up Time: 2 to 4 months. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Hosting: Servers. 
  • Gamification: Customizable gamification options that are made in-house. 
  • Bonuses: Customizable bonus options that are made in-house. 
  • CRM Marketing: BetConstruct offers CRM marketing as an optional product that costs 1,000 euros per month. 

SoftGamings 

SoftGamings was founded in 2007 as a small reseller, but grew into a business with over 500 full-time employees. The company develops Turnkey platforms, White Label platforms, Self-Service solutions and Bitcoin casino solutions. 

SoftGaming uses Betradar, Digitain, TG Lab and BetConstruct as sportsbook feed providers. Their sportsbook risk management is handled automatically using artificial intelligence and machine learning systems, which can be configurable via backoffice. The set-up time can take from one to four months depending on the level of customization the clients ask for, which can include missions, challenges, tournaments, leaderboards, achievements and badges. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Betradar, Digitain, TG Lab and BetConstruct. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: handled automatically using artificial intelligence and machine learning systems and configurable via backoffice. 
  • Set-up Time: 1 to 4 months. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Hosting: Physical server or cloud with CDN scalability. 
  • Gamification: Missions, challenges, tournaments, leaderboards, achievements and badges. 
  • Bonuses: Customizable bonus system with loyalty programs, tiered VIP programs, leveling up with XP, avatars, and custom profiles. 
  • CRM Marketing: SoftGamings offers CRM marketing. 

SoftSwiss 

SoftSwiss was founded in 2009 and, four years later, became the first to introduce cryptocurrencies to the traditional online casino. The company, which currently has headquarters in Poland, Malta, and Georgia, counts more than one thousand iGaming brands working around the world. 

SoftSwiss uses Bet Radar and Bet Construct as sportsbook feed providers and their sportsbook risk management is handled by third parties. The set-up time takes from three to six months, depending if you want to build a platform from scratch or use a pre-built template. They have customizable gamification and bonuses options, as well as CRM marketing. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Bet Radar and Bet Construct. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: Special risk management team with third party companies. 
  • Set-up Time: 3 to 6 months. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes.  
  • Hosting: Servers in Germany and Brazil. 
  • Gamification: Customizable bonuses. 
  • Bonuses: Free spins, wheel of fortune and physical prizes. 
  • CRM Marketing: offers CRM marketing. 

GiG (Gaming Innovation Group) 

The Gaming Innovation Group (GiG) was initially incorporated in 2008 as Donkr International in Malta. Today, the company operates two overall business units focused on the B2B market in iGaming. The platform division (GiG Core) develops digital products and offers managed services to online and land-based gaming companies. It is focused on Casino and Sports and the products include Player Account Management, Frontend, CMS, Data, Sports and Managed Services. It is licensed in Malta, UK, New Jersey (USA), Spain and Sweden. 

GiG uses Sportsradar and Bet Genius as sportsbook feed providers and have in-house tailored integrations for sportsbook risk management. Their set-up time is two to four months and they offer customizable gamification and bonuses. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Sportsradar and Bet Genius. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: in-house tailored integrations. 
  • Set-up Time: 2 to 4 months. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Gamification: Customizable. 
  • Bonuses: Customizable. 

GR8 Tech 

Based in Cyprus, GR8 Tech uses Sportradar, Bet Genius and Beter as sportsbook feed providers, but they also have in-house made feeds and risk management tools. To set up a platform, they need at least two months, but the company offers customizable and in-house developed gamification, bonuses and CRM and CMS marketing. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Sport Radar, Bet Genius, Beter and in-house. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: in-house risk management tools. 
  • Set-up Time: At least two months. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Hosting: Servers. 
  • Gamification: Customizable and developed in-house. 
  • Bonuses: Customizable and developed in-house. 
  • CRM Marketing: CRM and CMS made in-house. 

Altenar 

Altenar was founded in 2014 as an exclusive B2B company. It provides from standalone sportsbook products to the provision of turnkey sportsbook solutions. Currently, it has headquarters in the Isle of Man and offices in Europe and South America. 

Altenar has an in-house made sportsbook feed provider and sportsbook risk management and the set-up time ranges from one to two months. The company provides a 24/7 help chat for gamification and bonuses, which they developed in-house. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Made in-house, with integrations for specific betting content. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: Risk management tools made in-house. 
  • Set-up Time: 1 to 2 months. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Hosting: Altenar has servers in the Netherlands and is also fully on the cloud via Google and AWS. 
  • Gamification: In-house customizable options, with 24/7 help chat. 
  • Bonuses: In-house customizable options, with 24/7 help chat. 
  • CRM Marketing: Uses CMS and fast track CRM. 

OddsGate 

OddsGate was founded in 2021 and is based in Portugal. It currently has over 55 employees working in two offices and manages projects in more than six countries, which includes Brazil, Malta, Romania and Canada. 

OddsGate uses Sportsradar as both sportsbook feed provider and sportsbook risk management. They offer a fast set-up time that can range from two to three weeks and customizable gamification and bonus options. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Sportsradar. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: Sportsradar. 
  • Set-up Time: 2 to 3 weeks. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Hosting: Cloud. 
  • Gamification: Customizable. 
  • Bonuses: Customizable. 
  • CRM Marketing: CRM and DMS. 

PlaylogiQ 

Based in Cyprus, PlayLogiQ has over 10 years of experience in the iGaming and betting industry. The company was the first dedicated iGaming Bookmaker Software developed with knowledge of UX/UI and a studio of bespoke iGaming designs. 

PlaylogiQ uses Bet Radar and Bet Genius as sportsbook feed providers and have in-house made sportsbook risk management. Their set-up time is about one month and the gamification bonus options are customizable. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Bet Radar and Bet Genius. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: Made in-house. 
  • Set-up Time: 1 month. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Hosting: Cloud (AWS). 
  • Gamification: Customizable. 
  • Bonuses: Customizable. 
  • CRM Marketing: CRM and CMS. 

AP Gaming 

AP Gaming is focused mainly in Europe and Asia and offers iFrame solutions and esports solutions. They have in-house made sportsbook feed providers and sportsbook risk management. Their set-up time is fast, ranging from two to four weeks, but they don’t offer gamification, bonuses or CRM marketing. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Made in-house. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: Made in-house. 
  • Set-up Time: 2 to 4 weeks. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Hosting: Servers. 
  • Gamification: Doesn’t offer gamification. 
  • Bonuses: Doesn’t offer bonuses. 
  • CRM Marketing: Doesn’t offer CRM marketing. 

Vibra Gaming 

Based in Uruguay, Vibra Gaming was founded in 2020 and provides localized content and technology to land-based operators launching their online initiatives, including casino, sportsbooks, RGS and EGM products.   

Vibra Gaming is mainly focused in Latin America and uses Sportradar and Bet Construct as sportbooks feed providers. They have their own risk management for game odds, but can integrate external ones. Their set-up time is from three to five months to build a platform from scratch. If the front-end is already built, they can set it up in about one month. They offer gamification, bonuses and CRM marketing. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Sportradar and Bet Construct. 
  • Sportsbook Risk Management: VIbra Gaming has its own risk management for game odds, but can also integrate external ones. 
  • Set-up Time: 3 to 5 months if built from scratch; one month if the front-end is pre-built. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Hosting: Servers. 
  • Gamification: Vibra Gaming has gamification options.
  • Bonuses: Vibra Gaming offers bonuses. 
  • CRM Marketing: Vibra Gaming has CRM marketing options.

Sportingtech 

Based in Malta, Sportingtech is a provider of turnkey betting and gaming solutions designed for regulated and emerging markets around the globe. Their iGaming platform offers sportsbook, casino and retail via a modular system and intuitive back office for a fully omni-channel solution.

Sportingtech is also focused mainly in Latin America. They use Sportradar and Bet Genius as their sportbooks feed providers. The set-up time ranges from two to four months and the company uses smartico.ai to provide gamification and CRM marketing. 

  • Sportsbook Feed Provider: Sportradar and Bet Genius. 
  • Set-up Time: 2 to 4 months. 
  • Optimized for smartphones? Yes. 
  • Hosting: Sportingtech uses cloud for CDN and WAF, but has on-prem servers for hosting platforms and services. 
  • Gamification: Sportingtech has internal tools and also uses smatico.ai. 
  • Bonuses: With in-house bonus tools, you can create different kinds of campaigns. 
  • CRM Marketing: uses smartico.ai.

item.title: What are the most popular iGaming contents in Brazil and Latin America?
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
Latin America is experiencing an exponential increase in iGaming contents in the last few years. Brazil, in particular, changed its regulations in 2023 and allowed private companies to operate sports betting both online and in physical establishments. With a population of over 215 million people, Brazil is the seventh most populous country in the world and offers a huge opportunity for betting houses.

In this article, we will explore what are the most popular online games in Latin America and Brazil, including sports betting, casinos, lotteries and other mini games.

Sports betting

In the last five years, Latin America had an increase of 131% in active users of sports betting. In 2024, the number of people engaged in this activity was over 8.3 million. The main sport the population of this region bet on is football (soccer).

However, the search volume for football in sports betting in Brazil, specifically, has dropped 26% from February 2022 to February 2024. On the other hand, the search volume for volleyball and MMA increased 64% and 27%, respectively. Tennis and basketball complete the list of the top-5 most popular sports to bet on in Brazil. 

The average bet count per user in Brazil has also increased 115% in the last year. In February 2023, the number was US$ 5.8 and, in February 2024, it was US$ 12.5. The overall bet count increased 74% and the bet amount 274% in the same period.

Casino games

Online gambling has also increased in Latin America. The revenue of the sector in 2024 is more than 3 billion dollars, an increase of 117% when compared to 2022. Currently, there are over 9.5 million people in the region engaged in casino games. But what kind of games are the most popular?

In 2022, iGamingBrazil conducted a survey to see which casino games were more popular in Brazil. About 78% of those who answered the survey said that they played roulette, 66% revealed they played blackjack, 63% played slots, 61% poker and 50% live dealer games.

A keyword search made in 2024 confirmed the trend of two years ago, putting roulette as the favorite online casino game in Brazil, followed by poker and slots. The reason roulette is number one might be for its simplicity, which makes it accessible to novices and allows simple bets, such as red or black.

It is also worth noticing that the search volume for slot-related games increased over 400% from February 2022 to February 2024, indicating the growth of this type of game in the country.

Online Lotteries

Online lotteries include bingo, scratch cards and instant win games. As they are easy to access and play, and offer a chance to win money quickly, they are very popular in Latin America and Brazil.

In 2024, the revenue from online lotteries in Latin America is US$ 1.21 billion. The average revenue per user is US$ 224.6. 

Mini Games

The interest for mini games, especially crash games, also increased in Latin America. This trend is followed by an increase in smartphone use in the region - over 80% of the population had a device in 2023.

The search volume for minigame-related keywords was over 74 thousand in Argentina in July 2024, more than 49.5 thousand in Mexico, and over 40.5 thousand in Brazil and Colombia.

What are the most popular iGaming contents?

After exploring the main types of iGaming contents in Brazil and Latin America, what are the most popular ones after all?

Sports betting is currently driving more than half the market in the region. Football (soccer) is the main sport users bet on, mainly in Brazil. Online casino games follow the list, with roulette, poker and slots being the most popular.

It is also important to notice the increased interest in mini-games, which may be a trend for the market in the future. With the population of Latin America having more access to smartphones and internet, these types of iGaming contents might be a good bet for companies in the future.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Sports betting, casino, lotteries or mini games - which are the favorite iGaming contents for Latin Americans?

item.title: Essential guide to knowing your customer in Brazil
item.dc:creator: dmytro
item.content:encoded:
For any business looking, especially in the country you're looking into, is essential to knowing your customer. To expand or strengthen its presence and know your costumer in Brazil, understanding the local consumer mindset is not just an option—it’s a necessity. Brazil, known for its vibrant culture and diverse population, presents unique business challenges and opportunities. But beyond the economic potential, success hinges on how well a company knows and connects with its customers. This guide provides practical advice on how to navigate this complex market, offering insights into what drives Brazilian consumer behavior and how to engage with them effectively. 

1. Why understanding your customer in Brazil is different 

Brazil’s market is characterized by its diversity, not only in terms of geography but also in terms of socioeconomic and cultural factors. A deep knowledge of these aspects is crucial for businesses seeking to establish strong relationships and deliver tailored experiences that resonate. Unlike in more homogeneous markets, a strategy that works in São Paulo may not yield the same results in Rio de Janeiro or Recife. This variability demands a flexible approach that’s both data-driven and locally informed. 

Regional differences matter 

Brazil is a country of contrasts. From the affluent regions of the South to the less economically developed Northeast, consumer behavior varies significantly. To engage effectively, businesses must localize their strategies, adapting to the unique needs, preferences, and expectations of each region. Understanding these regional nuances is key to creating campaigns that resonate and connect on a deeper level. 

Cultural sensitivity is crucial 

Brazilians place a high value on personal relationships, trust, and respect. Business interactions often go beyond the transactional and involve building genuine connections. This focus on relationship-building influences everything from marketing to customer service. For foreign companies, demonstrating cultural sensitivity and a willingness to understand local customs can be the differentiator that fosters loyalty and brand advocacy. 

2. The consumer in Brazil mindset 

Trust and relationship building 

Understating your costumer in Brazil, establishing trust is fundamental to doing business. Brazilians prefer to buy from brands they feel connected to and trust. Companies must invest time and effort in building relationships, both online and offline. This includes engaging with customers on social media, providing excellent customer service, and maintaining a consistent brand presence that aligns with local values. 

Social media influence 

Brazil has one of the highest social media engagement rates in the world. Platforms like Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp play an essential role in shaping opinions and influencing purchasing decisions. For businesses, being present on these platforms is not enough—you must actively engage with users, respond to comments, and create content that sparks meaningful conversations. Leveraging influencers who resonate with local audiences is another powerful strategy for gaining credibility and trust. 

Price sensitivity vs. quality 

Brazilian consumers are known for being price-sensitive, but this doesn’t mean they prioritize cost over quality. They are willing to pay a premium for products that offer real value, particularly when it comes to brands that align with their values and lifestyle. Highlighting the unique benefits of your products or services, rather than competing solely on price, is a more sustainable strategy for winning over Brazilian consumers. 

Loyalty through personalization 

Personalized communication is highly effective in Brazil. Consumers expect companies to understand their preferences and cater to their individual needs. Implementing CRM tools that track customer behavior and interactions can help businesses tailor their offerings, delivering more relevant content, recommendations, and promotions that drive engagement and loyalty. 

Strategies for understanding your customer in Brazil 

Invest in local market research 

Local market research is essential for gaining a deep understanding of Brazilian consumers. Partner with local research firms to conduct surveys, focus groups, and in-depth interviews that reveal insights into regional differences, consumer pain points, and emerging trends. +

Use social listening to gain insights 

Social listening involves monitoring online conversations about your brand, industry, and competitors. Given the high level of social media activity in Brazil, this is a valuable tool for identifying customer sentiments, pain points, and opportunities for engagement. Use social listening tools to track hashtags, keywords, and mentions relevant to your brand. 

Develop localized buyer personas 

Creating buyer personas tailored to Brazilian consumers is critical. Segment your audience based on regional preferences, income levels, and digital behaviors. This will help you develop more effective marketing messages that resonate with the specific needs and desires of different customer segments. 

Leverage CRM tools for deeper insights 

Implementing a robust Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system can help you track customer interactions, identify trends, and personalize your communication. Using a platform like ours, which is designed to handle the complexities of diverse markets, businesses can access granular data about customer behavior, making it easier to segment audiences and create targeted campaigns. Our solution, in InPlaySoft, offers insights that are particularly useful for understanding the unique preferences and culturais nuances of Brazilian consumers, allowing for more accurate and effective communication. This approach not only boosts engagement but also enhances customer loyalty by making each interaction feel more personal and relevant. 

Building a Customer-Centric Strategy 

Focus on customer experience 

Customer experience is a key differentiator in Brazil. Ensure that every touchpoint, from your website to your customer service, is optimized to provide a seamless and positive experience. Pay attention to local language nuances, cultural references, and communication styles to make your customers feel understood and valued. 

Be responsive and accessible 

Brazilians expect quick and efficient responses, particularly on digital channels. Whether it’s resolving an issue on social media or answering a query on WhatsApp, being responsive can significantly impact your brand’s reputation. Consider using chatbots or automated tools to handle routine inquiries while maintaining a human touch for more complex interactions. 

Implement omnichannel strategies 

An omnichannel approach is crucial for engaging Brazilian consumers, who often interact with brands across multiple platforms. Ensure consistency in your messaging and experience across all channels, including social media, email, and offline touchpoints. This integrated strategy will help you build a stronger, more cohesive brand presence.

Understating your costumer in Brazil, establishing trust is fundamental to doing business. Brazilians prefer to buy from brands they feel

item.title: iGaming in Latin America: regulatory landscape, market analysis, challenges and opportunities
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
Latin America is a golden opportunity for iGaming operators. The region has a population of over 670 million people, with Brazil being the seventh most populous country on the planet. It also has a growing middle class, which means more people are having budgets for leisure, which include online gambling. Last, but not least, the legislation of many countries in the region is changing to accept iGaming. Brazil is, once again, an example, having changed ist regulations in 2023.

However, the very fact that the regulations are in constant change can make it hard for iGaming operators to enter the Latin American market. So, first of all, we will understand the current regulatory landscape of iGaming in the region.

Regulatory Landscape Of iGaming in Latin America

In Latin America, iGaming is legal in some countries, but illegal in others. Some are changing and adapting its regulations, while others are not. In this article, we will focus on three of the four most populous countries of the region: Brazil, Colombia and Argentina.

Brazil

Brazil first drafted a law regulating online gambling in 2018. In 2023, the country made more advances after President Lula da Silva enacted a comprehensive law on 30 December  which permits both online and land-based sports betting under Law No. 14790. 

Argentina

Argentina has a federation-like structure in which each of its 23 provinces and the city of Buenos Aires regulate iGaming independently from one another. The basic rule allows online gambling, which can be prohibited at a local level. As of now, online gambling is allowed, regulated and active in most provinces, while it is still a topic of discussion in a few locations. 

Colombia

Colombia pioneered the online gambling industry in Latin America by making it legal and licensing operators in 2016. Proper licensing and cooperation with operators lead to economic growth, and tax revenue from gambling funds have been contributing to the country’s healthcare system.

Licensing Requirements

The requirements to obtain a license for iGaming in Latin America varies from country to country. Mexico and Colombia have comprehensive and transparent frameworks, while Brazil’s are in development. Brazil recently required, for instance, that sports betting operators be located in the country rather than remotely.

Generally, to obtain a license for iGaming in Latin America, operators must have:

  • Financial stability and solvency
  • Proof of responsible gambling practices
  • Player information and fund protection
  • Anti-money laundering compliance
  • Technical and operational compliance
  • Tax and fee payments
  • Local legal entity
  • Compliance with country-specific regulations and licensing requirements
  • Expert legal advice on country-specific licensing processes

Market Analysis

According to a study conducted by ResearchAndMarkets.com, the Latin American gambling market will grow at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 18.4% between 2022 and 2028. Furthermore, according to Statista, Latin America’s online gambling market will grow exponentially to USD 3.4bn in 2025.

Nuvei, oh the other hand, provided detailed statistics on the number of daily visits to casino websites within a jurisdiction. The number one country in the world in this ranking is Brazil, with over 7.8 million visits per day. Mexico is number four on the list, after Nigeria and the United Kingdom, and Colombia is number eight.

Also according to Statista, the online Gross Gaming Revenue (GGR) of Colombia has been growing since 2018, peaking at roughly USD 300m in 2021. 

Challenges in the Latin American iGaming Market

One of the main challenges in the Latin American iGaming market is the payment processing. Many countries of the region have complex financial regulations which make it difficult both for players to make deposits and withdrawals from online casinos, and for operators to process payments efficiently and securely.

Currently, the three most popular payment systems in Latin America are PIX, Boleto and Pay4Fun. Pix is a government-developed payment system that was not particularly convenient for customers, so the Boleto system became the main entry point for players to secure payments in gambling in the region.

Most payments, however, are still processed through banks only on weekdays, what creates obstacles for operators. It could, for example, be a point of fraud from players when they gamble with funds that are not available in the account. Betting vouchers, which could be an alternative, can be sold offline and makes the gambling process close to being completely anonymous, what increases the risk of money laundering and other fraudulent schemes. 

Opportunities in the Latin American iGaming Market

Latin America may be a challenging region for iGaming at the moment, but it offers many opportunities for operators.

Mobile Gaming

In 2020, according to a study conducted by Statista, there were over 147 million mobile games in Latin America. This number is expected to increase 17% by 2025, which will account for almost 10% of all mobile gamers in the world.

Mobile gaming, therefore, is a great opportunity for operators. Investments in mobile-friendly games and platforms that can reach players on the go without keeping users tied to a computer should pay themselves out.

Esports 

Online betting in esports is rapidly increasing in Latin America. With the popularity of games such as League of Legends and Dota 2 rising, there is a growing demand for esports betting and tournaments.

Crypto

As more and more people become interested in digital currencies, Latin America is already the world’s 7th largest cryptocurrency market, according to Chainalysis. We expect an increase of cryptocurrency players in the iGaming industry in the upcoming years, so operators have an opportunity to expand gaming offerings for this market.

In conclusion, Latin America will definitely be one of the main markets in the world of iGaming in the next decade. Operators must prepare themselves for the region, as each country has its own laws and regulations. While some challenges remain to be tackled, the opportunities are many and promise to forever change the world scenario of iGaming.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: iGaming in Latin America: challenges and opportunities
With a population of over 670 million people, Latin America is a golden opportunity for iGaming operators

item.title: inplaySoft will be at the SBC Summit Latinoamérica!
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
From October 29 to 31, inplaySoft will be at the SBC Summit Latinoamérica, in Miami, United States. The event is a great opportunity for networking and learning more about the emerging market of iGaming in the region.

With a population of over 670 million people, Latin America might become one of the main iGaming markets in the world. However, the region is still adapting to sports betting and online casinos, and regulations are in constant change. The SBC Summit, therefore, is a place where operators can keep up with the latest news from the region, including its challenges and opportunities.

SBC Summit Latinoamérica

The SBC Summit Latinoamérica will cover the markets of Brazil, Mexico, Colombia, Argentina, Perú, Venezuela, Chile, Ecuador, Bolivia, Dominican Republic, Honduras, Paraguay, El Salvador, Guatemala, Nicaragua, Costa Rica, Panamá, Uruguay and Puerto Rico. The event will focus mainly on three elements:

  • Education: over 200 industry experts will share their experience regarding sports betting and online casinos. Topics such as marketing and affiliation, payments and compliance, relationships with sports teams and regulatory requirements will be discussed. There will also be country-specific roundtables for discussions.
  • Product display: over 70 brands will showcase their products and answer questions from the participants. Discussions will include sportsbook solutions, game studios, payment providers, CRM solutions, operators and more.
  • Networking: multiple themed gatherings and evening networking parties will make it easy for participants to forge new connections and increase their networking. Last year, 43% of the attendees of the event were senior decision-makers, with 23% comprising C-suite executives and Founders.

iGaming in Latin America

Latin America has a growing middle class, which means more people are having budgets for leisure, which include online gambling. According to a study conducted by ResearchAndMarkets.com, the Latin American gambling market will grow at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 18.4% between 2022 and 2028. Furthermore, according to Statista, Latin America’s online gambling market will grow exponentially to USD 3.4bn in 2025.

The largest country in Latin America is Brazil. With a population of over 215 million people, it is the seventh most populous nation in the world. The country changed its legislation in 2023 to adapt to the increasing iGaming market. As of now, private companies are able to operate sports betting both online and in physical establishments. This offers a golden opportunity for sports betting houses and online casinos.

According to Nuvei, Brazil is also the country with the biggest number of daily visits to casino websites in the world, with over 7.8 million visits per day. Mexico, another Latin America nation, is number four on the list, after Nigeria and the United Kingdom. Colombia is number eight.

More about inplaySoft

inplaySoft is specialized in providing cutting-edge iGaming solutions tailored to meet the dynamic needs of today’s gaming operators. We have a fully compliant KYC and document checks worldwide and we are also fully tailored for the existing and upcoming Brazilian regulations. We also have a multi-tenant platform, with which the clients can manage multiple brands from the same backoffice.

Furthermore, inplaySoft has an in-house development team that can fully customize the platform to suit the client’s needs. The customization for casino game descriptions and banners includes a field for meta-descriptions, to increase chances of ranking higher on google searches.

inplaySoft also offers a full gamification suite, which includes tournaments, rankings and leaderboards, so clients have access to a complete customer retention arsenal. Among other bonuses, we offer free spins, cashback, free bets and no risk bets.

item.title: How big was the Brazilian sports betting market in 2023?
item.dc:creator: Ricardo_A
item.content:encoded:
Sports betting houses and online casinos have taken Brazil by storm in recent years. The impact was so deep that the country changed its legislation twice in the last six years. In 2018, President Michel Temer authorized the offer of sports betting sites in Brazil. As a result, advertisements of sports betting began to dominate the TV broadcast. In 2023, the country allowed private companies to operate sports betting both online and in physical establishments. But how big is the Brazilian sports betting market?

How much was spent in the Brazilian sports betting market?

According to statistics from Brazil’s Central Bank (BC), Brazilians spent more than US$ 11 billion on sports betting between January and November 2023. Out of this amount, US$ 8.9 billion was spent on bets, while US$ 2.2 billion was spent on fees paid to betting sites.

This number is, for instance, bigger than the one generated by Brazilian beef exports in the same period. Brazil, one of the largest exporters of the product in the world, raised US$ 9.5 billion from the sector last year, according to Secex (Secretariat of Foreign Trade), linked to Mdic (Ministry of Development, Industry, Commerce and Services).

Statistics of the Brazilian sports betting market

According to data from a survey conducted by Datafolha on December 5, 2023, through more than 2,000 face-to-face interviews in 135 cities around Brazil with people over the age of 16, 15% of Brazilians have already used betting sites at least once, with 8% saying they were frequent bettors.

On average, a person spent R$ 263 per month on bets in 2023 - around 20% of the minimum wage during the period. According to the same study, 30% of bettors spend more than R$ 100 per month.

The survey also revealed that the activity is more popular among men and young people. Around 21% of men said they had already bet, while for women the number was 9%. Almost a third of those between 16 and 24 years old have already bet at least once, even though betting is illegal for those under 18.

As for the outcome of the bets, 51% of respondents said they lost more money than they won. On the other hand, 38% said they won more than they lost, while 10% said the numbers were similar.

Legislation and regulations in Brazil

Since sports betting was not regulated in Brazil in 2023, bookmakers operated in other countries where it was legal. Last year, however, US$ 7.1 billion returned to the country through prizes received by bettors.

The scenario should change in 2024, because in December 2023, President Lula's government sanctioned Law 14.790/23, which allows private companies to operate sports betting both online and in physical establishments. In addition, the law:

  • Increased the minimum age for placing sports bets from 18 to 21.
  • Banned advertising or any type of publicity aimed at minors.
  • Required verification and validation of bettors' identities.
  • Required bookmakers to implement policies to prevent money laundering schemes and promote responsible gambling.

In 2023, the Brazilian government also approved Provisional Measure (MP) No. 1,182/2023, which amends Law 13.756/18. See below what changed with the MP:

  • Monitoring: betting houses will have to purchase a license to operate in Brazil.
  • Legality: companies with valid licenses will be able to accept bets related to official sporting events organized by federations, leagues or confederations.
  • Taxes: players with winnings exceeding R$ 2,112 will have to pay 30% of their winnings in taxes, which is the same rate of lottery prizes. Betting houses, in turn, will have to pay an 18% rate on Gross Gaming Revenue (GGR), which is the revenue that comes from all games played, minus the prizes paid to players and taxes levied on legal entities. Companies in the sector, like any other, will also have to pay Brazilian taxes PIS, Cofins, Income Tax, CSLL and ISS.
  • Money laundering: betting houses will have to implement effective monitoring systems to prevent money laundering. They will have to submit information about bettors to the Financial Activities Control Council (Coaf).

Considering that, with a population of over 215 million people, Brazil is the seventh most populous country on the planet, the changes in its legislation open up a golden opportunity for bookmakers. inplaySoft, for example, is prepared to serve clients who want to enter the Brazilian market. The company has fully compliant KYC and document checks worldwide, including in Brazil. Learn more about us!
